Workflow.Name: PADFramework: FlowTemplate (WorkQueues)
Workflow.Definition:
"@@ConnectionString: '' @@Type: 'Local' @@DesktopType: 'local' @@DisplayName: 'Local computer' IMPORT 'controlRepo.appmask' AS appmask IMPORT 'imageRepo.imgrepo' AS imgrepo @SENSITIVE: [ErrorMessage] @OUTPUT ErrorMessage : { 'Description': '', 'FriendlyName': 'ErrorMessage', 'Type': 'String' } @OUTPUT Output_IsSuccess : { 'Description': '', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_IsSuccess', 'Type': 'Bool' } CALL Init Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END DateTime.GetCurrentDateTime.Local DateTimeFormat: DateTime.DateTimeFormat.DateAndTime CurrentDateTime=> CurrentDateTime ON ERROR GOTO Fatal END Text.ConvertDateTimeToText.FromCustomDateTime DateTime: CurrentDateTime CustomFormat: $'''yyyy-MM-dd''' Result=> DateStamp CALL Config IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''FATAL;;;%ErrorMessage%''' CALL Logger GOTO Fatal END CALL GetFlowSettings IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''FATAL;;;%ErrorMessage%''' CALL Logger GOTO Fatal END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Starting flow \"%FlowName%\"''' CALL Logger CALL ExecuteMainFlow IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;Failed to successfully run flow \"%FlowName%\". Last error: %ErrorMessage%. Flow stopped''' CALL Logger GOTO 'Exit' END SET Output_IsSuccess TO True SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Finishing flow \"%FlowName%\"''' CALL Logger END LABEL 'Exit' IF (List_ErrorMessages.Count) > (0) THEN CALL SendErrorMessages IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN CALL StopFlow END END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames EXIT Code: 0 LABEL Fatal CALL StopFlow FUNCTION Init GLOBAL **REGION Initializing variables /# Initializing variables. Setting blank values and 0 on numeric variables is not absolutely necessary - it can be skipped. Creating empty lists is also not mandatory, as "Add item to list" works without the list being initialized. It's added for some extra clarity and readability.#/ SET ErrorMessage TO '' SET ErrorCount TO 0 SET ExcelRestartCount TO 0 SET BrowserRestartCount TO 0 SET Output_IsSuccess TO False Variables.CreateNewList List=> List_SubflowNames Variables.CreateNewList List=> List_ErrorMessages Variables.CreateNewList List=> List_Attachments **ENDREGION **REGION Flow variables - adjust as necessary /# Flow and directory variables. ProjectName should match the directory name for the project. FlowName and UserFriendlyProjectName are used for logging and notifications.#/ SET ProjectName TO $'''{ReplaceMe}''' SET FlowName TO $'''{ReplaceMe}''' SET UserFriendlyProjectName TO $'''{ReplaceMe}''' # Directory can be adjusted if necessary as well. C:\RPA is just a suggestion. SET ProjectDirectory TO $'''C:\\RPA\\%ProjectName%''' **ENDREGION **REGION ConfigReader variables - adjust as necessary /# Config_Type is used by ConfigReader. Should be set to one of the following: - JSON - Excel - Database - SharePoint List - Dataverse#/ SET Config_Type TO $'''JSON''' /# Config_Address is used by ConfigReader. Should be blank for JSON files. Otherwise, should contain: - A connection string for getting Config values from a Database - A site address for for getting Config values from a SharePoint List - An environment URL for getting Config values from a Dataverse table - A file path for getting Config values from an Excel file#/ SET Config_Address TO $'''%''%''' /# Config_Path is used by ConfigReader. Should contain: - File path for JSON files (set in the Config subflow) - Sheet name for Excel files - SQL stored procedure name for Databases - SharePoint list name for SharePoint - Table logical name for Dataverse#/ SET Config_Path TO $'''%''%''' **ENDREGION **REGION Logger variables - adjust as necessary /# Log_Type is used by Logger. Should be set to one of the following: - Log File (plain text .log files) - CSV file - Database - SharePoint List#/ SET Log_Type TO $'''Log File''' /# Log_Address is used by Logger. Should be blank for plain text or CSV files. Otherwise, should contain: - A Connection string for logging to Database - A Site address for logging to SharePoint List#/ SET Log_Address TO $'''%''%''' /# Log_Path is used by Logger. Should contain: - File path for Plain text and CSV files (set in Config) - Database table name or stored procedure for Databases - SharePoint list name for SharePoint#/ SET Log_Path TO $'''%''%''' **ENDREGION **REGION Directories /# These directories should be created as needed: - Logs for logging to files. Not needed for logging to SharePoint lists or databases - Flow for any files that may be temporarily stored by the flow, as well as screenshots, etc. - Config for external config files. Not needed when Configs are stored in databases.#/ SET LogsDirectory TO $'''%ProjectDirectory%\\Logs''' SET FlowDirectory TO $'''%ProjectDirectory%\\Flow''' SET ConfigDirectory TO $'''%ProjectDirectory%\\Config''' **ENDREGION END FUNCTION FUNCTION Config GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET ConfigFile TO $'''%ConfigDirectory%\\Config.json''' **REGION Base Logger # Creating base logger with all log levels enabled so we can actually log errors/information from Config if it fails. SET Config_LoggerObject TO {{ }} SET Config_LoggerObject[$'''LogLevels'''] TO $'''TRACE,DEBUG,INFO,WARN,ERROR,FATAL''' SET Config_LoggerObject['ErrorLogLevels'] TO $'''ERROR,TRACE,FATAL''' **ENDREGION **REGION Log file path System.GetEnvironmentVariable.GetEnvironmentVariable Name: $'''COMPUTERNAME''' Value=> ComputerName SWITCH Log_Type CASE = $'''Log File''' SET Log_Path TO $'''%LogsDirectory%\\%DateStamp%_%FlowName%_%ComputerName%.log''' CASE = $'''CSV File''' SET Log_Path TO $'''%LogsDirectory%\\%DateStamp%_%FlowName%_%ComputerName%.csv''' END **ENDREGION @@flowname: 'PADFramework: ConfigReader' External.RunFlow FlowId: 'c74ad727-5617-4d54-89a9-9d7b35187d34' @Input_ConfigType: Config_Type @Input_ConfigPath: Config_Path @Input_ConfigAddress: Config_Address @Input_ProjectName: ProjectName @Output_ConfigObject=> Config_Object @Output_Message=> Output_Message @Output_Status=> Output_Status IF Output_Status <> 200 THEN SET ErrorMessage TO Output_Message GOTO 'Exit' END # Conversion needed in case the objects are stored as JSON strings in configs (e.g. Dataverse, Database, SharePoint, Excel) Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_Object['Recipient'] CustomObject=> Config_RecipientObject Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_Object['Logger'] CustomObject=> Config_LoggerObject Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_Object['MaxErrorCount'] CustomObject=> Config_MaxErrorCountObject IF Contains(Config_Object, $'''ScreenshotsPath''', False) THEN SET Config_ScreenshotsPath TO Config_Object['ScreenshotsPath'] END IF Contains(Config_Object, $'''URL''', False) THEN Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_Object['URL'] CustomObject=> Config_URLObject END IF Contains(Config_Object, $'''HTMLTemplatePath''', False) THEN SET Config_HTMLTemplatePath TO Config_Object['HTMLTemplatePath'] END /# Environment values: - PROD - TEST - DEV #/ SET Config_Environment TO Config_Object['Environment'] END LABEL 'Exit' END FUNCTION FUNCTION Logger GLOBAL BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all END # TRACE level used in "On block error" blocks only, indicating a system exception. IF Log_Message = $'''TRACE''' THEN ERROR => ErrorMessage SET Log_Message TO $'''%Log_Message%;;;%ErrorMessage%''' END /# Adjust the parameters according to your logging needs. The current settings will log to a plain text .log file.#/ @@flowname: 'PADFramework: Logger' External.RunFlow FlowId: '2a80c691-72fd-4222-99f2-2a4ee54b2b71' @Input_SubflowNamesList: List_SubflowNames @Input_LoggerObject: Config_LoggerObject @Input_LogPath: Log_Path @Input_LogMessage: Log_Message @Input_LogType: Log_Type @Input_ErrorMessageList: List_ErrorMessages @Input_FlowName: FlowName @Input_ProjectName: ProjectName @Input_LogAddress: Log_Address @Output_ErrorMessageList=> List_ErrorMessages @Output_ErrorMessage=> Output_Message IF IsNotEmpty(Output_Message) THEN # Not calling ThrowFatalError here to prevent logical recursion. SET ErrorMessage TO Output_Message SET Output_IsSuccess TO False EXIT Code: 0 END SET Log_Message TO '' EXIT FUNCTION END # Retrieving the error captured by the block ERROR => ErrorMessage IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Output_IsSuccess TO False EXIT Code: 0 END END FUNCTION FUNCTION StopFlow GLOBAL /# Description: This subflow gets the last occurred exception and stops the flow with the exception message. If the error handling is configured to do so, it would also send an email about the fatal error. Params: - None Returns: - Nothing #/ SET Output_IsSuccess TO False ERROR => ErrorMessage EXIT Code: 0 END FUNCTION FUNCTION SendErrorMessages GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET HTML_EmailMessage TO $'''

You are receiving this message because you are set as the recipient for error/warning messages on project %ProjectName%. If you do not want to receive these messages in the future, please contact support.

Please see the messages below and take appropriate action. If the above explanations do not cover the messages you receive and you are not sure whether or not you need to take any action, please contact support for guidance.

Hello,

The project %UserFriendlyProjectName% (%ProjectName%) flow \"%FlowName%\" has completed {{TextToReplace}} and produced the following error log messages:

%List_ErrorMessages%

Please act accordingly.
Best regards,
Robot

''' IF Output_IsSuccess = True THEN Text.Replace Text: HTML_EmailMessage TextToFind: $'''{{TextToReplace}}''' IsRegEx: False IgnoreCase: False ReplaceWith: $'''successfully''' ActivateEscapeSequences: False Result=> HTML_EmailMessage ELSE Text.Replace Text: HTML_EmailMessage TextToFind: $'''{{TextToReplace}}''' IsRegEx: False IgnoreCase: False ReplaceWith: $'''unsuccessfully''' ActivateEscapeSequences: False Result=> HTML_EmailMessage END IF Config_Environment <> $'''PROD''' THEN SET ErrorLogRecipient TO Config_RecipientObject['Default'] ELSE SET ErrorLogRecipient TO Config_RecipientObject['Error'] END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Sending error messages to \"%ErrorLogRecipient%\"''' CALL Logger # Use either 'EmailSender' or 'EmailSenderO365Outlook' depending on the mailbox type you want to send the message from. @@flowname: 'PADFramework: EmailSenderO365Outlook' External.RunFlow FlowId: 'c515285c-5a5d-4379-b50b-96837d0796d2' @Input_Attachments: List_Attachments @Input_EmailMessage: HTML_EmailMessage @Input_EmailRecipient: ErrorLogRecipient @Input_EmailRecipientCC: $'''%''%''' @Input_EmailSubject: $'''%ProjectName% error log''' @Input_HTMLTemplatePath: Config_HTMLTemplatePath @Output_Message=> Output_Message @Output_Status=> Output_Status END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION ExecuteMainFlow GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END CALL PrepareSystem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END /# Add custom subflow calls here. Call GenerateWorkItems instead of ProcessWorkItems if this flow is supposed to be the work item generator and not the processor.#/ CALL ProcessWorkItems IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END CALL PrepareSystem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION PrepareSystem GLOBAL /# Description: 1. Closing any applications used by this flow. 2. Clearing any temporary files that may interfere with the flow. 3. Must be run in the beginning of the main flow (after Config). Also recommended to run at the end for cleanup purposes.#/ SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END CALL CloseBrowser IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END CALL CloseExcel IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END /# Add additional subflow calls as necessary. Remove CloseBrowser and/or CloseExcel if irrelevant. #/ END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION CloseBrowser GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END /# The browser instance is a text value if is not instantiated and it does not have a .Handle property. Attempting to close with the happy path first.#/ IF IsNotEmpty(BrowserToClose) THEN IF (BrowserToClose.Handle) <> (-1) THEN WebAutomation.CloseWebBrowser BrowserInstance: BrowserToClose ON ERROR REPEAT 3 TIMES WAIT 3 ON ERROR END IF BrowserToClose.IsAlive = False THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END END /# Will close all browsers and all instances. Provide a browser name and URL (as variables) to close a specific browser and/or tab.#/ @@flowname: 'PADFramework: BrowserCloser' External.RunFlow FlowId: 'a08238ca-5ec4-422d-8eaf-1766d05ec8fe' @Input_Browser: $'''''' @Input_URL: $'''''' @Output_Message=> Output_Message @Output_Status=> Output_Status IF Output_Status <> 200 THEN SET ErrorMessage TO Output_Message GOTO 'Exit' END Variables.IncreaseVariable Value: BrowserRestartCount IncrementValue: 1 IF BrowserRestartCount >= Config_MaxErrorCountObject['Web'] THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''FATAL;;;The browser has been restarted %BrowserRestartCount% time(s). Assuming it has fallen into an infinite loop and stopping the flow.''' CALL Logger CALL ThrowFatalError END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION ThrowFatalError GLOBAL Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''FATAL;;;A fatal error has occurred. Stopping the flow \"%FlowName%\"''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames # These variables need to be reset, as there is a circular call between ThrowFatalError and any of the Close* subflows. SET ErrorCount TO 0 SET ExcelRestartCount TO 0 SET BrowserRestartCount TO 0 CALL PrepareSystem CALL SendErrorMessages CALL StopFlow END FUNCTION FUNCTION CloseExcel GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END # Attempting to close with the happy path first before calling ExcelCloser. IF IsNotEmpty(ExcelToClose) THEN IF ExcelToClose.Handle <> 0 THEN BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all END Excel.CloseExcel.Close Instance: ExcelToClose WAIT (System.WaitForProcess.ProcessToStop ProcessName: $'''EXCEL''') FOR 10 ON ERROR TimeoutError END IF (System.IfProcess.ProcessIsNotRunning ProcessName: $'''EXCEL''') THEN ON ERROR END GOTO 'Exit' END END END END /# Will close all Excel instances by default. Provide a file path as an input parameter to close a specific file.#/ @@flowname: 'PADFramework: ExcelCloser' External.RunFlow FlowId: 'a261fa2e-fce6-49c8-909a-a94012906030' @Input_FilePath: $'''''' @Output_Message=> Output_Message @Output_Status=> Output_Status IF Output_Status <> 200 THEN SET ErrorMessage TO Output_Message GOTO 'Exit' END Variables.IncreaseVariable Value: ExcelRestartCount IncrementValue: 1 IF ExcelRestartCount >= Config_MaxErrorCountObject['Excel'] THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''FATAL;;;Excel has been restarted %ExcelRestartCount% time(s). Assuming it has fallen into an infinite loop and stopping the flow.''' CALL Logger CALL ThrowFatalError END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION ExecuteExcelFlow GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET ExcelDocument TO Config_FlowObject['ExcelDocument'] /# These retries will apply to each work item retry (3 Excel retries times 3 work item retries by default). If you want to do less attempts, reduce the max error count values in config or remove this loop.#/ LOOP ErrorCount FROM 0 TO Config_MaxErrorCountObject['Excel'] STEP 1 CALL CloseExcel IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END IF (File.IfFile.DoesNotExist File: ExcelDocument) THEN SET ErrorMessage TO $'''File \"%ExcelDocument%\" does not exist. ''' GOTO 'Exit' END Excel.LaunchExcel.LaunchAndOpen Path: ExcelDocument Visible: False ReadOnly: False LoadAddInsAndMacros: False Instance=> ExcelMain # Replace this comment custom subflow calls. IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;Failed to process Excel due to %ErrorMessage%. Retrying''' CALL Logger NEXT LOOP END EXIT LOOP END SET ExcelToClose TO ExcelMain CALL CloseExcel IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''WARN;;;%ErrorMessage%. Ignoring error and continuing''' CALL Logger SET ErrorMessage TO '' END IF (ErrorCount) >= (Config_MaxErrorCountObject['Excel']) THEN SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Excel automation failed after retrying for %Config_MaxErrorCountObject['Excel']% times.''' END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION ProcessWorkItems GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END @@'InputSummaryValue:WORKQUEUE': 'WorkItem' LOOP WHILE (WorkQueues.ProcessWorkQueueItem WorkQueue: $'''4b22c5ab-fce5-ee11-904c-0022487f2c0b''' WorkQueueItem=> WorkQueueItem) CALL ResetVariables CALL GetWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET WorkItem_Status TO $'''Fail''' SET WorkItem_Message TO $'''Failed to get the contents of work item with number %WorkItem_Number% and Id %WorkItem_Id% due to: %ErrorMessage%.''' SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;%WorkItem_Message%''' CALL Logger CALL CompleteWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END NEXT LOOP END LOOP WorkItem_ErrorCount FROM 1 TO Config_MaxErrorCountObject['WorkItem'] STEP 1 CALL ProcessWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET WorkItem_Status TO $'''Fail''' SET WorkItem_Message TO $'''Failed to process work item with number %WorkItem_Number% and Id %WorkItem_Id% due to: %ErrorMessage%. Retrying.''' SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;%WorkItem_Message%''' CALL Logger CALL CleanupOnError IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;Failed to clean up for work item %WorkItem_Number% and Id %WorkItem_Id% due to: %ErrorMessage%. Ignoring error''' CALL Logger SET ErrorMessage TO $'''%''%''' END NEXT LOOP END EXIT LOOP END IF (WorkItem_Status = 'Fail' AND WorkItem_ErrorCount >= Config_MaxErrorCountObject['WorkItem']) = True THEN SET WorkItem_Message TO $'''Failed to process work item with number %WorkItem_Number% and Id %WorkItem_Id% after %WorkItem_ErrorCount% attempt(s). ''' SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;%WorkItem_Message%''' CALL Logger END SET Log_Message TO $'''DEBUG;;;Work item %WorkItem_Number%/%WorkItem_Id% status=(WorkItem_Status=%WorkItem_Status%;WorkItem_Message=%WorkItem_Message%)''' CALL Logger CALL CompleteWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION ResetVariables GLOBAL # Reset WorkItem variables SET WorkItem_Status TO $'''%''%''' SET WorkItem_Message TO $'''%''%''' SET WorkItem_DataContent TO $'''%''%''' SET WorkItem_Id TO '' SET WorkItem_Number TO '' SET WorkItem_DataSource TO '' END FUNCTION FUNCTION ProcessWorkItem GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END # Replace this comment with custom subflows IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END SET WorkItem_Status TO $'''Success''' SET WorkItem_Message TO $'''Successfully processed work item with number %WorkItem_Number% and Id %WorkItem_Id%.''' END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION CleanupOnError GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END # If needed, call `TakeScreenshot` subflow to take a screenshot before calling any `Close*` subflows (except CloseExcel). WorkQueues.UpdateProcessingNotes.WithProcessingNotes WorkQueueItem: WorkQueueItem ProcessingNotes: $'''Status: %WorkItem_Status%; Message: %WorkItem_Message%''' CALL PrepareSystem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION GetWorkItem GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET WorkItem_Id TO WorkQueueItem['Id'] SET WorkItem_Number TO WorkQueueItem['Name'] Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: WorkQueueItem['Value'] CustomObject=> WorkItem_DataContent SET WorkItem_DataSource TO WorkItem_DataContent['DataSource'] END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION CompleteWorkItem GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SWITCH WorkItem_Status CASE = $'''Success''' WorkQueues.UpdateWorkQueueItem.UpdateWithProcessingNotes WorkQueueItem: WorkQueueItem Status: WorkQueues.WorkQueueItemStatus.Processed ProcessingResult: WorkItem_Message CASE = $'''Skip''' WorkQueues.UpdateWorkQueueItem.UpdateWithProcessingNotes WorkQueueItem: WorkQueueItem Status: WorkQueues.WorkQueueItemStatus.BusinessException ProcessingResult: WorkItem_Message CASE = $'''Fail''' WorkQueues.UpdateWorkQueueItem.UpdateWithProcessingNotes WorkQueueItem: WorkQueueItem Status: WorkQueues.WorkQueueItemStatus.ITException ProcessingResult: WorkItem_Message DEFAULT WorkQueues.UpdateWorkQueueItem.UpdateWithProcessingNotes WorkQueueItem: WorkQueueItem Status: WorkQueues.WorkQueueItemStatus.GenericException ProcessingResult: WorkItem_Message END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION ExecuteWebFlow GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END /# These retries will apply to each work item retry (3 web retries times 3 work item retries by default). If you want to do less attempts, reduce the max error count values in config or remove this loop.#/ LOOP ErrorCount FROM 1 TO Config_MaxErrorCountObject['Web'] STEP 1 IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;%ErrorMessage%''' CALL Logger SET ErrorMessage TO '' CALL TakeScreenshot IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;%ErrorMessage%''' CALL Logger SET ErrorMessage TO '' END END CALL PrepareWebPage IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN NEXT LOOP END # Replace this comment with custom subflows EXIT LOOP END IF (ErrorCount) >= (Config_MaxErrorCountObject['Web']) THEN SET WorkItem_Status TO $'''Fail''' SET WorkItem_Message TO $'''Web Automation failed after %ErrorCount% attempts.''' END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION PrepareWebPage GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END /# Checking for whether a browser instance is alive to not clean up on each retry and work item. Additional checks for specific page title or URL or even a window can be added to check if the flow can recover without restarting the browser.#/ IF IsNotEmpty(BrowserMain) THEN IF (BrowserMain.Handle <> -1 AND BrowserMain.IsAlive = True) = True THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Browser is open and ready.''' CALL Logger GOTO 'Exit' END END CALL CloseBrowser IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END CALL LaunchBrowser IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END # Login subflow to be used only when relevant to login to the web page. CALL LoginToWebPage IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION LaunchBrowser GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET URL TO Config_URLObject['Main'] /# Will launch Edge in normal mode by default. Adjust input parameters as necessary.#/ SET Browser TO $'''Edge''' @@flowname: 'PADFramework: BrowserLauncher' External.RunFlow FlowId: 'aa0a967a-5f8c-4891-b6c1-87536e7f3d0b' @Input_Browser: Browser @Input_URL: URL @Input_IncognitoMode: False @Output_Status=> Output_Status @Output_Message=> Output_Message IF Output_Status <> 200 THEN SET ErrorMessage TO Output_Message END SWITCH Browser CASE = $'''Chrome''' WebAutomation.LaunchChrome.AttachToChromeByUrl TabUrl: URL AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserMain CASE = $'''Edge''' WebAutomation.LaunchEdge.AttachToEdgeByUrl TabUrl: URL AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserMain CASE = $'''Firefox''' WebAutomation.LaunchFirefox.AttachToFirefoxByUrl TabUrl: URL AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserMain END SET BrowserToClose TO BrowserMain END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION LoginToWebPage GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END /# Populate credentials. Press button to login. Wait for page to load.#/ # Check if Credentials are correct. If they are not => call ThrowFatalError END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION TakeScreenshot GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END DateTime.GetCurrentDateTime.Local DateTimeFormat: DateTime.DateTimeFormat.DateAndTime CurrentDateTime=> CurrentDateTime Text.ConvertDateTimeToText.FromCustomDateTime DateTime: CurrentDateTime CustomFormat: $'''yyyy-MM-dd HHmmss''' Result=> Timestamp SET ScreenshotFileName TO $'''%WorkItem_Id% %WorkItem_Number% %Timestamp%.png''' @@flowname: 'PADFramework: ScreenshotMaker' External.RunFlow FlowId: '8bba4a93-fbb7-478c-b098-a5ca91273227' @Input_ScreenshotsDirectory: Config_ScreenshotsPath @Input_ScreenshotFileName: ScreenshotFileName @Output_Message=> Output_Message @Output_Status=> Output_Status IF Output_Status <> 200 THEN SET ErrorMessage TO Output_Message GOTO 'Exit' END SET Log_Message TO $'''DEBUG;;;Successfully took screenshot `%ScreenshotFileName%`''' CALL Logger END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION Template GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION GetFlowSettings GLOBAL /# Gets settings from Config for a specific Flow. Parameters that are available globally in the config (MaxErrorCount, Logger, Environment, Recipient, etc.) are not mandatory, but can be set per flow, too. Custom parameters specific to a certain flow should be set in the flow object and not the global Config.#/ SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET Config_FlowObject TO Config_Object['Flows'][FlowName] IF Contains(Config_FlowObject, $'''MaxErrorCount''', False) THEN Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_FlowObject['MaxErrorCount'] CustomObject=> Config_MaxErrorCountObject END IF Contains(Config_FlowObject, $'''Logger''', False) THEN Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_FlowObject['Logger'] CustomObject=> Config_LoggerObject IF NotContains(Config_LoggerObject, $'''LogLevels''', False) THEN SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Modules => %FlowName% => Logger => LogLevels''' GOTO 'Exit' ELSE IF NotContains(Config_LoggerObject, $'''ErrorLogLevels''', False) THEN SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Modules => %FlowName% => Logger => ErrorLogLevels''' GOTO 'Exit' END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Using logger settings from the flow environment''' CALL Logger END IF Contains(Config_FlowObject, $'''Environment''', False) THEN SET Config_Environment TO Config_FlowObject['Environment'] END IF Contains(Config_FlowObject, $'''Recipient''', False) THEN Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_FlowObject['Recipient'] CustomObject=> Config_RecipientObject END IF Contains(Config_FlowObject, $'''ScreenshotsPath''', False) THEN SET Config_ScreenshotsPath TO Config_FlowObject['ScreenshotsPath'] END IF Contains(Config_FlowObject, $'''URL''', False) THEN Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_FlowObject['URL'] CustomObject=> Config_URLObject END IF Contains(Config_FlowObject, $'''HTMLTemplatePath''', False) THEN SET Config_HTMLTemplatePath TO Config_FlowObject['HTMLTemplatePath'] END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Environment is %Config_Environment%''' CALL Logger END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION GenerateWorkItems GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END /# Replace this comment with custom subflows for retrieving the work item data from some data source. Delete the "Create new data table" action afterwards - it is only used to create a variable so that the loop has something to iterate through.#/ Variables.CreateNewDatatable InputTable: { } DataTable=> DataTable_WorkItems LOOP FOREACH DataRow_CurrentWorkItem IN DataTable_WorkItems CALL SerializeWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END CALL InsertWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION SerializeWorkItem GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET WorkItem_DataContent TO {{ }} /# Replace this comment with "Set variable" actions adding values from the %DataRow_CurrentWorkItem% variable to the custom object. Add as many as needed. Also set: - WorkItem_Number - WorkItem_DataSource#/ SET WorkItem_DataContent['DataSource'] TO WorkItem_DataSource Variables.ConvertCustomObjectToJson CustomObject: WorkItem_DataContent Json=> WorkItem_DataContent END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION InsertWorkItem GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END # Adjust priority, expiration and other parameters as necessary. @@'InputSummaryValue:WORKQUEUE': 'WorkItem' WorkQueues.EnqueueWorkQueueItem.WithoutUniqueId WorkQueue: $'''4b22c5ab-fce5-ee11-904c-0022487f2c0b''' Status: WorkQueues.WorkQueueItemEnqueueStatus.Queued Priority: WorkQueues.WorkQueueItemPriority.Normal Name: WorkItem_Number Value: WorkItem_DataContent END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION GetSubflowName GLOBAL ERROR => MockError Reset: True Text.ParseText.RegexParseForFirstOccurrence Text: MockError.Location TextToFind: $'''(?<=Subflow:\\s).+(?=,\\sAction:)''' StartingPosition: 0 IgnoreCase: False Match=> SubflowName Variables.AddItemToList Item: SubflowName List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION "

Workflow.Name: PADFramework: FlowTemplate
Workflow.Definition:
"@@ConnectionString: '' @@Type: 'Local' @@DesktopType: 'local' @@DisplayName: 'Local computer' IMPORT 'controlRepo.appmask' AS appmask IMPORT 'imageRepo.imgrepo' AS imgrepo @SENSITIVE: [ErrorMessage] @OUTPUT ErrorMessage : { 'Description': '', 'FriendlyName': 'ErrorMessage', 'Type': 'String' } @OUTPUT Output_IsSuccess : { 'Description': '', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_IsSuccess', 'Type': 'Bool' } CALL Init Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END DateTime.GetCurrentDateTime.Local DateTimeFormat: DateTime.DateTimeFormat.DateAndTime CurrentDateTime=> CurrentDateTime ON ERROR GOTO Fatal END Text.ConvertDateTimeToText.FromCustomDateTime DateTime: CurrentDateTime CustomFormat: $'''yyyy-MM-dd''' Result=> DateStamp CALL Config IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''FATAL;;;%ErrorMessage%''' CALL Logger GOTO Fatal END CALL GetFlowSettings IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''FATAL;;;%ErrorMessage%''' CALL Logger GOTO Fatal END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Starting flow \"%FlowName%\"''' CALL Logger CALL ExecuteMainFlow IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;Failed to successfully run flow \"%FlowName%\". Last error: %ErrorMessage%. Flow stopped''' CALL Logger GOTO 'Exit' END SET Output_IsSuccess TO True SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Finishing flow \"%FlowName%\"''' CALL Logger END LABEL 'Exit' IF (List_ErrorMessages.Count) > (0) THEN CALL SendErrorMessages IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN CALL StopFlow END END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames EXIT Code: 0 LABEL Fatal CALL StopFlow FUNCTION Init GLOBAL **REGION Initializing variables /# Initializing variables. Setting blank values and 0 on numeric variables is not absolutely necessary - it can be skipped. Creating empty lists is also not mandatory, as "Add item to list" works without the list being initialized. It's added for some extra clarity and readability.#/ SET ErrorMessage TO '' SET ErrorCount TO 0 SET ExcelRestartCount TO 0 SET BrowserRestartCount TO 0 SET Output_IsSuccess TO False Variables.CreateNewList List=> List_SubflowNames Variables.CreateNewList List=> List_ErrorMessages Variables.CreateNewList List=> List_Attachments **ENDREGION **REGION Flow variables - adjust as necessary /# Flow and directory variables. ProjectName should match the directory name for the project. FlowName and UserFriendlyProjectName are used for logging and notifications.#/ SET ProjectName TO $'''{ReplaceMe}''' SET FlowName TO $'''{ReplaceMe}''' SET UserFriendlyProjectName TO $'''{ReplaceMe}''' # Directory can be adjusted if necessary as well. C:\RPA is just a suggestion. SET ProjectDirectory TO $'''C:\\RPA\\%ProjectName%''' **ENDREGION **REGION ConfigReader variables - adjust as necessary /# Config_Type is used by ConfigReader. Should be set to one of the following: - JSON - Excel - Database - SharePoint List - Dataverse#/ SET Config_Type TO $'''JSON''' /# Config_Address is used by ConfigReader. Should be blank for JSON files. Otherwise, should contain: - A connection string for getting Config values from a Database - A site address for for getting Config values from a SharePoint List - An environment URL for getting Config values from a Dataverse table - A file path for getting Config values from an Excel file#/ SET Config_Address TO $'''%''%''' /# Config_Path is used by ConfigReader. Should contain: - File path for JSON files (set in the Config subflow) - Sheet name for Excel files - SQL stored procedure name for Databases - SharePoint list name for SharePoint - Table logical name for Dataverse#/ SET Config_Path TO $'''%''%''' **ENDREGION **REGION Logger variables - adjust as necessary /# Log_Type is used by Logger. Should be set to one of the following: - Log File (plain text .log files) - CSV file - Database - SharePoint List#/ SET Log_Type TO $'''Log File''' /# Log_Address is used by Logger. Should be blank for plain text or CSV files. Otherwise, should contain: - A Connection string for logging to Database - A Site address for logging to SharePoint List#/ SET Log_Address TO $'''%''%''' /# Log_Path is used by Logger. Should contain: - File path for Plain text and CSV files (set in Config) - Database table name or stored procedure for Databases - SharePoint list name for SharePoint#/ SET Log_Path TO $'''%''%''' **ENDREGION **REGION Directories /# These directories should be created as needed: - Logs for logging to files. Not needed for logging to SharePoint lists or databases - Flow for any files that may be temporarily stored by the flow, as well as screenshots, etc. - Config for external config files. Not needed when Configs are stored in databases.#/ SET LogsDirectory TO $'''%ProjectDirectory%\\Logs''' SET FlowDirectory TO $'''%ProjectDirectory%\\Flow''' SET ConfigDirectory TO $'''%ProjectDirectory%\\Config''' **ENDREGION END FUNCTION FUNCTION Config GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET ConfigFile TO $'''%ConfigDirectory%\\Config.json''' **REGION Base Logger # Creating base logger with all log levels enabled so we can actually log errors/information from Config if it fails. SET Config_LoggerObject TO {{ }} SET Config_LoggerObject[$'''LogLevels'''] TO $'''TRACE,DEBUG,INFO,WARN,ERROR,FATAL''' SET Config_LoggerObject['ErrorLogLevels'] TO $'''ERROR,TRACE,FATAL''' **ENDREGION **REGION Log file path System.GetEnvironmentVariable.GetEnvironmentVariable Name: $'''COMPUTERNAME''' Value=> ComputerName SWITCH Log_Type CASE = $'''Log File''' SET Log_Path TO $'''%LogsDirectory%\\%DateStamp%_%FlowName%_%ComputerName%.log''' CASE = $'''CSV File''' SET Log_Path TO $'''%LogsDirectory%\\%DateStamp%_%FlowName%_%ComputerName%.csv''' END **ENDREGION @@flowname: 'PADFramework: ConfigReader' External.RunFlow FlowId: 'c74ad727-5617-4d54-89a9-9d7b35187d34' @Input_ConfigType: Config_Type @Input_ConfigPath: Config_Path @Input_ConfigAddress: Config_Address @Input_ProjectName: ProjectName @Output_ConfigObject=> Config_Object @Output_Message=> Output_Message @Output_Status=> Output_Status IF Output_Status <> 200 THEN SET ErrorMessage TO Output_Message GOTO 'Exit' END # Conversion needed in case the objects are stored as JSON strings in configs (e.g. Dataverse, Database, SharePoint, Excel) Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_Object['Recipient'] CustomObject=> Config_RecipientObject Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_Object['Logger'] CustomObject=> Config_LoggerObject Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_Object['MaxErrorCount'] CustomObject=> Config_MaxErrorCountObject IF Contains(Config_Object, $'''ScreenshotsPath''', False) THEN SET Config_ScreenshotsPath TO Config_Object['ScreenshotsPath'] END IF Contains(Config_Object, $'''URL''', False) THEN Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_Object['URL'] CustomObject=> Config_URLObject END IF Contains(Config_Object, $'''HTMLTemplatePath''', False) THEN SET Config_HTMLTemplatePath TO Config_Object['HTMLTemplatePath'] END /# Environment values: - PROD - TEST - DEV #/ SET Config_Environment TO Config_Object['Environment'] END LABEL 'Exit' END FUNCTION FUNCTION Logger GLOBAL BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all END # TRACE level used in "On block error" blocks only, indicating a system exception. IF Log_Message = $'''TRACE''' THEN ERROR => ErrorMessage SET Log_Message TO $'''%Log_Message%;;;%ErrorMessage%''' END /# Adjust the parameters according to your logging needs. The current settings will log to a plain text .log file.#/ @@flowname: 'PADFramework: Logger' External.RunFlow FlowId: '2a80c691-72fd-4222-99f2-2a4ee54b2b71' @Input_SubflowNamesList: List_SubflowNames @Input_LoggerObject: Config_LoggerObject @Input_LogPath: Log_Path @Input_LogMessage: Log_Message @Input_LogType: Log_Type @Input_ErrorMessageList: List_ErrorMessages @Input_FlowName: FlowName @Input_ProjectName: ProjectName @Input_LogAddress: Log_Address @Output_ErrorMessageList=> List_ErrorMessages @Output_ErrorMessage=> Output_Message IF IsNotEmpty(Output_Message) THEN # Not calling ThrowFatalError here to prevent logical recursion. SET ErrorMessage TO Output_Message SET Output_IsSuccess TO False EXIT Code: 0 END SET Log_Message TO '' EXIT FUNCTION END # Retrieving the error captured by the block ERROR => ErrorMessage IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Output_IsSuccess TO False EXIT Code: 0 END END FUNCTION FUNCTION StopFlow GLOBAL /# Description: This subflow gets the last occurred exception and stops the flow with the exception message. If the error handling is configured to do so, it would also send an email about the fatal error. Params: - None Returns: - Nothing #/ SET Output_IsSuccess TO False ERROR => ErrorMessage EXIT Code: 0 END FUNCTION FUNCTION SendErrorMessages GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET HTML_EmailMessage TO $'''

You are receiving this message because you are set as the recipient for error/warning messages on project %ProjectName%. If you do not want to receive these messages in the future, please contact support.

Please see the messages below and take appropriate action. If the above explanations do not cover the messages you receive and you are not sure whether or not you need to take any action, please contact support for guidance.

Hello,

The project %UserFriendlyProjectName% (%ProjectName%) flow \"%FlowName%\" has completed {{TextToReplace}} and produced the following error log messages:

%List_ErrorMessages%

Please act accordingly.
Best regards,
Robot

''' IF Output_IsSuccess = True THEN Text.Replace Text: HTML_EmailMessage TextToFind: $'''{{TextToReplace}}''' IsRegEx: False IgnoreCase: False ReplaceWith: $'''successfully''' ActivateEscapeSequences: False Result=> HTML_EmailMessage ELSE Text.Replace Text: HTML_EmailMessage TextToFind: $'''{{TextToReplace}}''' IsRegEx: False IgnoreCase: False ReplaceWith: $'''unsuccessfully''' ActivateEscapeSequences: False Result=> HTML_EmailMessage END IF Config_Environment <> $'''PROD''' THEN SET ErrorLogRecipient TO Config_RecipientObject['Default'] ELSE SET ErrorLogRecipient TO Config_RecipientObject['Error'] END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Sending error messages to \"%ErrorLogRecipient%\"''' CALL Logger # Use either 'EmailSender' or 'EmailSenderO365Outlook' depending on the mailbox type you want to send the message from. @@flowname: 'PADFramework: EmailSenderO365Outlook' External.RunFlow FlowId: 'c515285c-5a5d-4379-b50b-96837d0796d2' @Input_Attachments: List_Attachments @Input_EmailMessage: HTML_EmailMessage @Input_EmailRecipient: ErrorLogRecipient @Input_EmailRecipientCC: $'''%''%''' @Input_EmailSubject: $'''%ProjectName% error log''' @Input_HTMLTemplatePath: Config_HTMLTemplatePath @Output_Message=> Output_Message @Output_Status=> Output_Status END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION ExecuteMainFlow GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END CALL PrepareSystem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END /# Add custom subflow calls here. Call GenerateWorkItems instead of ProcessWorkItems if this flow is supposed to be the work item generator and not the processor.#/ CALL ProcessWorkItems IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END CALL PrepareSystem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION PrepareSystem GLOBAL /# Description: 1. Closing any applications used by this flow. 2. Clearing any temporary files that may interfere with the flow. 3. Must be run in the beginning of the main flow (after Config). Also recommended to run at the end for cleanup purposes.#/ SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END CALL CloseBrowser IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END CALL CloseExcel IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END /# Add additional subflow calls as necessary. Remove CloseBrowser and/or CloseExcel if irrelevant. #/ END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION CloseBrowser GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END /# The browser instance is a text value if is not instantiated and it does not have a .Handle property. Attempting to close with the happy path first.#/ IF IsNotEmpty(BrowserToClose) THEN IF (BrowserToClose.Handle) <> (-1) THEN WebAutomation.CloseWebBrowser BrowserInstance: BrowserToClose ON ERROR REPEAT 3 TIMES WAIT 3 ON ERROR END IF BrowserToClose.IsAlive = False THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END END /# Will close all browsers and all instances. Provide a browser name and URL (as variables) to close a specific browser and/or tab.#/ @@flowname: 'PADFramework: BrowserCloser' External.RunFlow FlowId: 'a08238ca-5ec4-422d-8eaf-1766d05ec8fe' @Input_Browser: $'''''' @Input_URL: $'''''' @Output_Message=> Output_Message @Output_Status=> Output_Status IF Output_Status <> 200 THEN SET ErrorMessage TO Output_Message GOTO 'Exit' END Variables.IncreaseVariable Value: BrowserRestartCount IncrementValue: 1 IF BrowserRestartCount >= Config_MaxErrorCountObject['Web'] THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''FATAL;;;The browser has been restarted %BrowserRestartCount% time(s). Assuming it has fallen into an infinite loop and stopping the flow.''' CALL Logger CALL ThrowFatalError END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION ThrowFatalError GLOBAL Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''FATAL;;;A fatal error has occurred. Stopping the flow \"%FlowName%\"''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames # These variables need to be reset, as there is a circular call between ThrowFatalError and any of the Close* subflows. SET ErrorCount TO 0 SET ExcelRestartCount TO 0 SET BrowserRestartCount TO 0 CALL PrepareSystem CALL SendErrorMessages CALL StopFlow END FUNCTION FUNCTION CloseExcel GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END # Attempting to close with the happy path first before calling ExcelCloser. IF IsNotEmpty(ExcelToClose) THEN IF ExcelToClose.Handle <> 0 THEN BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all END Excel.CloseExcel.Close Instance: ExcelToClose WAIT (System.WaitForProcess.ProcessToStop ProcessName: $'''EXCEL''') FOR 10 ON ERROR TimeoutError END IF (System.IfProcess.ProcessIsNotRunning ProcessName: $'''EXCEL''') THEN ON ERROR END GOTO 'Exit' END END END END /# Will close all Excel instances by default. Provide a file path as an input parameter to close a specific file.#/ @@flowname: 'PADFramework: ExcelCloser' External.RunFlow FlowId: 'a261fa2e-fce6-49c8-909a-a94012906030' @Input_FilePath: $'''''' @Output_Message=> Output_Message @Output_Status=> Output_Status IF Output_Status <> 200 THEN SET ErrorMessage TO Output_Message GOTO 'Exit' END Variables.IncreaseVariable Value: ExcelRestartCount IncrementValue: 1 IF ExcelRestartCount >= Config_MaxErrorCountObject['Excel'] THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''FATAL;;;Excel has been restarted %ExcelRestartCount% time(s). Assuming it has fallen into an infinite loop and stopping the flow.''' CALL Logger CALL ThrowFatalError END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION ExecuteExcelFlow GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET ExcelDocument TO Config_FlowObject['ExcelDocument'] /# These retries will apply to each work item retry (3 Excel retries times 3 work item retries by default). If you want to do less attempts, reduce the max error count values in config or remove this loop.#/ LOOP ErrorCount FROM 0 TO Config_MaxErrorCountObject['Excel'] STEP 1 CALL CloseExcel IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END IF (File.IfFile.DoesNotExist File: ExcelDocument) THEN SET ErrorMessage TO $'''File \"%ExcelDocument%\" does not exist. ''' GOTO 'Exit' END Excel.LaunchExcel.LaunchAndOpen Path: ExcelDocument Visible: False ReadOnly: False LoadAddInsAndMacros: False Instance=> ExcelMain # Replace this comment custom subflow calls. IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;Failed to process Excel due to %ErrorMessage%. Retrying''' CALL Logger NEXT LOOP END EXIT LOOP END SET ExcelToClose TO ExcelMain CALL CloseExcel IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''WARN;;;%ErrorMessage%. Ignoring error and continuing''' CALL Logger SET ErrorMessage TO '' END IF (ErrorCount) >= (Config_MaxErrorCountObject['Excel']) THEN SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Excel automation failed after retrying for %Config_MaxErrorCountObject['Excel']% times.''' END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION ProcessWorkItems GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END LOOP WHILE (1) = (1) CALL ResetVariables CALL GetWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET WorkItem_Status TO $'''Fail''' SET WorkItem_Reason TO $'''GetWorkItemFailure''' SET WorkItem_Message TO $'''Failed to get the contents of work item with number %WorkItem_Number% and Id %WorkItem_Id% due to: %ErrorMessage%.''' SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;%WorkItem_Message%''' CALL Logger CALL CompleteWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END NEXT LOOP ELSE IF IsEmpty(WorkItem_Id) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;No work items to process.''' CALL Logger EXIT LOOP END CALL ProcessWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET WorkItem_Status TO $'''Fail''' SET WorkItem_Reason TO $'''ProcessingFailure''' SET WorkItem_Message TO $'''Failed to process work item with number %WorkItem_Number% and Id %WorkItem_Id% due to: %ErrorMessage%. Retrying.''' SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;%WorkItem_Message%''' CALL Logger CALL CleanupOnError IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;Failed to clean up for work item %WorkItem_Number% and Id %WorkItem_Id% due to: %ErrorMessage%. Ignoring error''' CALL Logger SET ErrorMessage TO $'''%''%''' END NEXT LOOP END SET Log_Message TO $'''DEBUG;;;Work item %WorkItem_Number%/%WorkItem_Id% status=(WorkItem_Status=%WorkItem_Status%;WorkItem_Message=%WorkItem_Message%)''' CALL Logger CALL CompleteWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION ResetVariables GLOBAL # Reset WorkItem variables SET WorkItem_Status TO $'''%''%''' SET WorkItem_Reason TO $'''%''%''' SET WorkItem_Message TO $'''%''%''' SET WorkItem_DataContent TO {{ }} SET WorkItem_Id TO '' SET WorkItem_Number TO '' SET WorkItem_RetrieveCount TO '' SET WorkItem_DataSource TO '' SET WorkItem_Priority TO $'''Normal''' SET WorkItem_ProcessingStartTime TO $'''%''%''' END FUNCTION FUNCTION ProcessWorkItem GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END # Replace this comment with custom subflows IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END SET WorkItem_Status TO $'''Success''' SET WorkItem_Reason TO $'''%''%''' SET WorkItem_Message TO $'''Successfully processed work item with number %WorkItem_Number% and Id %WorkItem_Id%.''' END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION CleanupOnError GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END # If needed, call `TakeScreenshot` subflow to take a screenshot before calling any `Close*` subflows (except CloseExcel). CALL UpsertWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END IF WorkItem_RetrieveCount >= (Config_MaxErrorCountObject['WorkItem'] - 1) THEN SET WorkItem_Status TO $'''Fail''' SET WorkItem_Reason TO $'''MaxRetryFailure''' SET WorkItem_Message TO $'''Failed to process work item with number %WorkItem_Number% and Id %WorkItem_Id% after %WorkItem_RetrieveCount% attempt(s). Skipping this work item''' SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;%WorkItem_Message%''' CALL Logger CALL CompleteWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END CALL PrepareSystem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION GetWorkItem GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET WorkItem_Operation TO $'''Get''' CALL HandleWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION CompleteWorkItem GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET WorkItem_Operation TO $'''Complete''' CALL HandleWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION ExecuteWebFlow GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END /# These retries will apply to each work item retry (3 web retries times 3 work item retries by default). If you want to do less attempts, reduce the max error count values in config or remove this loop.#/ LOOP ErrorCount FROM 1 TO Config_MaxErrorCountObject['Web'] STEP 1 IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;%ErrorMessage%''' CALL Logger SET ErrorMessage TO '' CALL TakeScreenshot IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''ERROR;;;%ErrorMessage%''' CALL Logger SET ErrorMessage TO '' END END CALL PrepareWebPage IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN NEXT LOOP END # Replace this comment with custom subflows EXIT LOOP END IF (ErrorCount) >= (Config_MaxErrorCountObject['Web']) THEN SET WorkItem_Status TO $'''Fail''' SET WorkItem_Reason TO $'''ProcessingFailure''' SET WorkItem_Message TO $'''Web Automation failed after %ErrorCount% attempts.''' END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION PrepareWebPage GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END /# Checking for whether a browser instance is alive to not clean up on each retry and work item. Additional checks for specific page title or URL or even a window can be added to check if the flow can recover without restarting the browser.#/ IF IsNotEmpty(BrowserMain) THEN IF (BrowserMain.Handle <> -1 AND BrowserMain.IsAlive = True) = True THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Browser is open and ready.''' CALL Logger GOTO 'Exit' END END CALL CloseBrowser IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END CALL LaunchBrowser IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END # Login subflow to be used only when relevant to login to the web page. CALL LoginToWebPage IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION LaunchBrowser GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET URL TO Config_URLObject['Main'] /# Will launch Edge in normal mode by default. Adjust input parameters as necessary.#/ SET Browser TO $'''Edge''' @@flowname: 'PADFramework: BrowserLauncher' External.RunFlow FlowId: 'aa0a967a-5f8c-4891-b6c1-87536e7f3d0b' @Input_Browser: Browser @Input_URL: URL @Input_IncognitoMode: False @Output_Status=> Output_Status @Output_Message=> Output_Message IF Output_Status <> 200 THEN SET ErrorMessage TO Output_Message END SWITCH Browser CASE = $'''Chrome''' WebAutomation.LaunchChrome.AttachToChromeByUrl TabUrl: URL AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserMain CASE = $'''Edge''' WebAutomation.LaunchEdge.AttachToEdgeByUrl TabUrl: URL AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserMain CASE = $'''Firefox''' WebAutomation.LaunchFirefox.AttachToFirefoxByUrl TabUrl: URL AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserMain END SET BrowserToClose TO BrowserMain END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION LoginToWebPage GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END /# Populate credentials. Press button to login. Wait for page to load.#/ # Check if Credentials are correct. If they are not => call ThrowFatalError END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION TakeScreenshot GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END DateTime.GetCurrentDateTime.Local DateTimeFormat: DateTime.DateTimeFormat.DateAndTime CurrentDateTime=> CurrentDateTime Text.ConvertDateTimeToText.FromCustomDateTime DateTime: CurrentDateTime CustomFormat: $'''yyyy-MM-dd HHmmss''' Result=> Timestamp SET ScreenshotFileName TO $'''%WorkItem_Id% %WorkItem_Number% %Timestamp%.png''' @@flowname: 'PADFramework: ScreenshotMaker' External.RunFlow FlowId: '8bba4a93-fbb7-478c-b098-a5ca91273227' @Input_ScreenshotsDirectory: Config_ScreenshotsPath @Input_ScreenshotFileName: ScreenshotFileName @Output_Message=> Output_Message @Output_Status=> Output_Status IF Output_Status <> 200 THEN SET ErrorMessage TO Output_Message GOTO 'Exit' END SET Log_Message TO $'''DEBUG;;;Successfully took screenshot `%ScreenshotFileName%`''' CALL Logger END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION Template GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION GetFlowSettings GLOBAL /# Gets settings from Config for a specific Flow. Parameters that are available globally in the config (MaxErrorCount, Logger, Environment, Recipient, etc.) are not mandatory, but can be set per flow, too. Custom parameters specific to a certain flow should be set in the flow object and not the global Config.#/ SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET Config_FlowObject TO Config_Object['Flows'][FlowName] IF Contains(Config_FlowObject, $'''MaxErrorCount''', False) THEN Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_FlowObject['MaxErrorCount'] CustomObject=> Config_MaxErrorCountObject END IF Contains(Config_FlowObject, $'''Logger''', False) THEN Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_FlowObject['Logger'] CustomObject=> Config_LoggerObject IF NotContains(Config_LoggerObject, $'''LogLevels''', False) THEN SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Modules => %FlowName% => Logger => LogLevels''' GOTO 'Exit' ELSE IF NotContains(Config_LoggerObject, $'''ErrorLogLevels''', False) THEN SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Modules => %FlowName% => Logger => ErrorLogLevels''' GOTO 'Exit' END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Using logger settings from the flow environment''' CALL Logger END IF Contains(Config_FlowObject, $'''Environment''', False) THEN SET Config_Environment TO Config_FlowObject['Environment'] END IF Contains(Config_FlowObject, $'''Recipient''', False) THEN Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_FlowObject['Recipient'] CustomObject=> Config_RecipientObject END IF Contains(Config_FlowObject, $'''ScreenshotsPath''', False) THEN SET Config_ScreenshotsPath TO Config_FlowObject['ScreenshotsPath'] END IF Contains(Config_FlowObject, $'''URL''', False) THEN Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: Config_FlowObject['URL'] CustomObject=> Config_URLObject END IF Contains(Config_FlowObject, $'''HTMLTemplatePath''', False) THEN SET Config_HTMLTemplatePath TO Config_FlowObject['HTMLTemplatePath'] END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Environment is %Config_Environment%''' CALL Logger END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION HandleWorkItem GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END @@flowname: 'PADFramework: WorkItemHandler' External.RunFlow FlowId: 'ba8eaa10-fb57-4fef-9240-e2690d67b906' @Input_WorkItemOperation: WorkItem_Operation @Input_WorkItemId: WorkItem_Id @Input_WorkItemNumber: WorkItem_Number @Input_WorkItemData: WorkItem_DataContent @Input_WorkItemStatus: WorkItem_Status @Input_WorkItemMessage: WorkItem_Message @Input_WorkItemDataSource: WorkItem_DataSource @Input_ProjectName: ProjectName @Input_FlowName: FlowName @Input_DatabaseType: Config_Object['WorkItemDatabaseType'] @Input_ConnectionString: Config_Object['WorkItemDatabaseConnectionString']['Config_Environment'] @Input_WorkItemProcessingStartTime: WorkItem_ProcessingStartTime @Input_WorkItemReason: WorkItem_Reason @Input_MaxRetrieveCount: Config_MaxErrorCountObject['WorkItem'] @Input_Environment: Config_Environment @Input_WorkItemPriority: WorkItem_Priority @Output_WorkItemId=> WorkItem_Id @Output_WorkItemNumber=> WorkItem_Number @Output_WorkItemData=> WorkItem_DataContent @Output_WorkItemRetrieveCount=> WorkItem_RetrieveCount @Output_WorkItemDataSource=> WorkItem_DataSource @Output_Message=> Output_Message @Output_Status=> Output_Status @Output_WorkItemProcessingStartTime=> WorkItem_ProcessingStartTime @Output_WorkItemPriority=> WorkItem_Priority IF Output_Status >= 300 THEN SET ErrorMessage TO Output_Message GOTO 'Exit' END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION UpsertWorkItem GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET WorkItem_Operation TO $'''Upsert''' CALL HandleWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION GenerateWorkItems GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END /# Replace this comment with custom subflows for retrieving the work item data from some data source. Delete the "Create new data table" action afterwards - it is only used to create a variable so that the loop has something to iterate through.#/ Variables.CreateNewDatatable InputTable: { } DataTable=> DataTable_WorkItems LOOP FOREACH DataRow_CurrentWorkItem IN DataTable_WorkItems CALL SerializeWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END CALL UpsertWorkItem IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN GOTO 'Exit' END END END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION SerializeWorkItem GLOBAL SET ErrorMessage TO '' Text.ToNumber Text: $'''\'\'''' ON ERROR CALL GetSubflowName END SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;Start''' CALL Logger BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all SET Log_Message TO $'''TRACE''' CALL Logger END SET WorkItem_DataContent TO {{ }} /# Replace this comment with "Set variable" actions adding values from the %DataRow_CurrentWorkItem% variable to the custom object. Add as many as needed. Also set: - WorkItem_Number - WorkItem_DataSource#/ END LABEL 'Exit' SET Log_Message TO $'''INFO;;;End''' CALL Logger Variables.RemoveItemFromList.RemoveItemFromListByIndex ItemIndex: List_SubflowNames.Count - 1 List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION FUNCTION GetSubflowName GLOBAL ERROR => MockError Reset: True Text.ParseText.RegexParseForFirstOccurrence Text: MockError.Location TextToFind: $'''(?<=Subflow:\\s).+(?=,\\sAction:)''' StartingPosition: 0 IgnoreCase: False Match=> SubflowName Variables.AddItemToList Item: SubflowName List: List_SubflowNames END FUNCTION "
