Workflow.Definition:
"@@ConnectionString: ''
@@Type: 'Local'
@@DesktopType: 'local'
@@DisplayName: 'Local computer'
IMPORT 'controlRepo.appmask' AS appmask
IMPORT 'imageRepo.imgrepo' AS imgrepo
@SENSITIVE: [Input_EmailRecipient, Input_EmailRecipientCC, Input_ExchangeObject, Input_SMTPObject, Output_Message, Input_EmailMessage]
@INPUT Input_Attachments : { 'Description': 'Provide attachments (if any) to be added to the email message in a form of a list of file paths.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_Attachments', 'Type': 'List', 'IsOptional': True, 'DefaultValue': [] } 
@INPUT Input_DisplayName : { 'Description': 'Provide the sender name to be displayed to the recipient(s) of the email.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_DisplayName', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@INPUT Input_EmailAccount : { 'Description': 'Provide the account to be used when sending the email.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_EmailAccount', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@INPUT Input_EmailRecipient : { 'Description': '''Provide the recipient(s) to send the email to.
If multiple recipients are provided, separate them by a semicolon.''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_EmailRecipient', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@INPUT Input_EmailRecipientCC : { 'Description': '''Provide CC recipient(s) of the email (optional)
If multiple recipients are provided, separate them by a semicolon.''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_EmailRecipientCC', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': True } 
@INPUT Input_EmailSubject : { 'Description': 'Provide the subject text for the email.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_EmailSubject', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@INPUT Input_ExchangeObject : { 'Description': '''Provide a custom object with Exchange server parameters (optional for other mailbox types).
If left blank, default values will be used.
Parameters expected:
1. Server - the server address
1. Domain - for the user account
1. Username
1. Password''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_ExchangeObject', 'Type': 'CustomObject', 'IsOptional': True, 'DefaultValue': {{ }} } 
@INPUT Input_HTMLTemplatePath : { 'Description': 'Provide the path to the HTML template for the email body.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_HTMLTemplatePath', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@INPUT Input_MailboxType : { 'Description': '''Provide the type of mailbox to be used.
Supported options are:
1. Exchange 
1. Outlook
1. SMTP
''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_MailboxType', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@INPUT Input_SMTPObject : { 'Description': '''Provide a custom object with SMTP server parameters (optional for other mailbox types).
Parameters expected:
1. Server - the server address
1. Port
1. Username
1. Password''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_SMTPObject', 'Type': 'CustomObject', 'IsOptional': True, 'DefaultValue': {{ }} } 
@OUTPUT Output_Message : { 'Description': 'The flow response.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_Message', 'Type': 'String' } 
@OUTPUT Output_Status : { 'Description': 'The status of the flow. Uses standard HTTP status codes.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_Status', 'Type': 'Numeric' } 
@INPUT Input_EmailMessage : { 'Description': '''Please provide the email message to be sent.
The message should be formatted as HTML. Otherwise, it will be sent as a single blob of text inside an HTML message.''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_EmailMessage', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
# Setting the status and message to 'Bad Request' by default in case the flow fails.
SET Output_Status TO 400
SET Output_Message TO $'''Bad Request'''
BLOCK 
ON BLOCK ERROR all

END
 CALL SetEmailBody
 SWITCH Input_MailboxType
 CASE = $'''Exchange'''
 CALL SendEmailViaExchange
 CASE = $'''Outlook'''
 CALL SendEmailViaOutlook
 CASE = $'''SMTP'''
 CALL SendEmailViaSMTP
 DEFAULT
 SET Output_Status TO 400
 SET Output_Message TO $'''Mailbox type \'%Input_MailboxType%\' is not supported by the Email Sender flow.'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 SET Output_Status TO 200
 SET Output_Message TO $'''Successfully sent an email with subject text \'%Input_EmailSubject%\' to \'%Input_EmailRecipient%\''''
 LABEL 'Exit'
 EXIT Code: 0
END
ERROR => ErrorMessage
SET Output_Status TO 500
SET Output_Message TO $'''Failed to send an email due to %ErrorMessage%'''
FUNCTION SendEmailViaExchange GLOBAL
 IF (Contains(Input_ExchangeObject, 'Server', False) AND Contains(Input_ExchangeObject, 'Username', False)) = True THEN
 IF (IsNotEmpty(Input_ExchangeObject['Server']) AND IsNotEmpty(Input_ExchangeObject['Server'])) = True THEN
 Exchange.ConnectToExchangeServer.ConnectToServerWithCredentials ServerVersion: Exchange.ServerVersion.Exchange2013_SP1 ServerAddress: Input_ExchangeObject['Server'] Domain: Input_ExchangeObject['Domain'] Username: Input_ExchangeObject['Username'] Password: Input_ExchangeObject['Password'] Timeout: 30 Connection=> ExchangeConnection
 ELSE IF IsNotEmpty(Input_ExchangeObject['Server']) THEN
 Exchange.ConnectToExchangeServer.ConnectToServer ServerVersion: Exchange.ServerVersion.Exchange2013_SP1 ServerAddress: Input_ExchangeObject['Server'] Timeout: 30 Connection=> ExchangeConnection
 ELSE IF IsNotEmpty(Input_ExchangeObject['Username']) THEN
 Exchange.ConnectToExchangeServer.ConnectWithCredentials ServerVersion: Exchange.ServerVersion.Exchange2013_SP1 EmailAddress: Input_EmailAccount Domain: Input_ExchangeObject['Domain'] Username: Input_ExchangeObject['Username'] Password: Input_ExchangeObject['Password'] Timeout: 30 Connection=> ExchangeConnection
 ELSE
 Exchange.ConnectToExchangeServer.Connect ServerVersion: Exchange.ServerVersion.Exchange2013_SP1 EmailAddress: Input_EmailAccount Timeout: 30 Connection=> ExchangeConnection
 END
 ELSE
 Exchange.ConnectToExchangeServer.Connect ServerVersion: Exchange.ServerVersion.Exchange2013_SP1 EmailAddress: Input_EmailAccount Timeout: 30 Connection=> ExchangeConnection
 END
 IF IsNotEmpty(Input_Attachments) THEN
 Exchange.SendMessage Connection: ExchangeConnection SendFrom: Input_EmailAccount SenderDisplayName: Input_DisplayName SendTo: Input_EmailRecipient CC: Input_EmailRecipientCC Subject: Input_EmailSubject Body: HTMLEmailBody IsBodyHtml: True Attachments: Input_Attachments
 ELSE
 Exchange.SendMessage Connection: ExchangeConnection SendFrom: Input_EmailAccount SenderDisplayName: Input_DisplayName SendTo: Input_EmailRecipient CC: Input_EmailRecipientCC Subject: Input_EmailSubject Body: HTMLEmailBody IsBodyHtml: True
 END
END FUNCTION
FUNCTION SendEmailViaOutlook GLOBAL
 Outlook.Launch Instance=> OutlookInstance
 IF IsNotEmpty(Input_Attachments) THEN
 Outlook.SendEmailThroughOutlook.SendEmail Instance: OutlookInstance Account: Input_EmailAccount SendTo: Input_EmailRecipient CC: Input_EmailRecipientCC Subject: Input_EmailSubject Body: HTMLEmailBody IsBodyHtml: True IsDraft: False Attachments: Input_Attachments
 ELSE
 Outlook.SendEmailThroughOutlook.SendEmail Instance: OutlookInstance Account: Input_EmailAccount SendTo: Input_EmailRecipient CC: Input_EmailRecipientCC Subject: Input_EmailSubject Body: HTMLEmailBody IsBodyHtml: True IsDraft: False
 END
END FUNCTION
FUNCTION SendEmailViaSMTP GLOBAL
 IF IsNotEmpty(Input_Attachments) THEN
 Email.SendEmail.AuthenticateAndSend SMTPServer: Input_SMTPObject['Server'] Port: Input_SMTPObject['Port'] EnableSSL: True Username: Input_SMTPObject['Username'] Password: Input_SMTPObject['Password'] AcceptUntrustedCertificates: True SendFrom: Input_EmailAccount SenderDisplayName: Input_DisplayName SendTo: Input_EmailRecipient CC: Input_EmailRecipientCC Subject: Input_EmailSubject Body: HTMLEmailBody IsBodyHtml: True Attachments: Input_Attachments
 ELSE
 Email.SendEmail.AuthenticateAndSend SMTPServer: Input_SMTPObject['Server'] Port: Input_SMTPObject['Port'] EnableSSL: True Username: Input_SMTPObject['Username'] Password: Input_SMTPObject['Password'] AcceptUntrustedCertificates: True SendFrom: Input_EmailAccount SenderDisplayName: Input_DisplayName SendTo: Input_EmailRecipient CC: Input_EmailRecipientCC Subject: Input_EmailSubject Body: HTMLEmailBody IsBodyHtml: True
 END
END FUNCTION
FUNCTION SetEmailBody GLOBAL
 IF IsNotEmpty(Input_HTMLTemplatePath) THEN
 File.ReadTextFromFile.ReadText File: Input_HTMLTemplatePath Encoding: File.TextFileEncoding.UTF8 Content=> HTMLEmailBody
 Text.Replace Text: HTMLEmailBody TextToFind: $'''{EmailMessage}''' IsRegEx: False IgnoreCase: False ReplaceWith: Input_EmailMessage ActivateEscapeSequences: False Result=> HTMLEmailBody
 ELSE
 SET HTMLEmailBody TO Input_EmailMessage
 END
END FUNCTION
"

Workflow.Name: PADFramework: BrowserCloser
Workflow.Inputs:
{"schema":{"required":[],"properties":{"Input_Browser":{"isOptional":true,"default":"","description":"Please provide the name of the browser to close. If no name is provided, all browser windows will be closed.
Available options:
- Chrome
- Edge
- Firefox","format":null,"title":"Input_Browser","type":"string","value":null},"Input_URL":{"isOptional":true,"default":"","description":"Please provide the URL of the browser tab to be closed.
If no URL is provided, all browser tabs will be closed.","format":null,"title":"Input_URL","type":"string","value":null}},"type":"object"}}
Workflow.Outputs: {"schema":{"properties":{"Output_Message":{"default":"","description":"The flow response.","format":"password","title":"Output_Message","type":"string","value":null},"Output_Status":{"default":"","description":"The status of the flow. Workflow.Definition:
"@@ConnectionString: ''
@@Type: 'Local'
@@DesktopType: 'local'
@@DisplayName: 'Local computer'
IMPORT 'controlRepo.appmask' AS appmask
IMPORT 'imageRepo.imgrepo' AS imgrepo
@SENSITIVE: [Output_Message]
@INPUT Input_Browser : { 'Description': '''Please provide the name of the browser to close. If no name is provided, all browser windows will be closed.
Available options:
- Chrome
- Edge
- Firefox''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_Browser', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': True } 
@OUTPUT Output_Message : { 'Description': 'The flow response.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_Message', 'Type': 'String' } 
@OUTPUT Output_Status : { 'Description': 'The status of the flow. Uses standard HTTP status codes.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_Status', 'Type': 'Numeric' } 
@INPUT Input_URL : { 'Description': '''Please provide the URL of the browser tab to be closed.
If no URL is provided, all browser tabs will be closed.''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_URL', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': True } 
SET Output_Status TO 200
BLOCK 
ON BLOCK ERROR all

END
 SWITCH Input_Browser
 CASE = $'''Chrome'''
 CALL CloseChrome
 CASE = $'''Edge'''
 CALL CloseEdge
 CASE = $'''Firefox'''
 CALL CloseFirefox
 DEFAULT
 SET Output_Message TO $'''Closing all browsers as the input browser name was either unrecognized or empty (\"%Input_Browser%\").'''
 CALL CloseChrome
 CALL CloseEdge
 CALL CloseFirefox
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 Text.AppendLine Text: Output_Message LineToAppend: $'''Successfully closed %Input_Browser%.''' Result=> Output_Message
 LABEL 'Exit'
 EXIT Code: 0
END
ERROR => ErrorMessage
SET Output_Status TO 500
Text.AppendLine Text: Output_Message LineToAppend: $'''Failed to close browser due to %ErrorMessage%''' Result=> Output_Message
FUNCTION CloseChrome GLOBAL
 IF (UIAutomation.IfWindow.IsNotOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''*Google Chrome*''' Class: $'''*''') THEN
 Text.AppendLine Text: Output_Message LineToAppend: $'''Browser %Input_Browser% is not open. Not closing it.''' Result=> Output_Message
 EXIT FUNCTION
 ELSE
 UIAutomation.CloseWindow.CloseByTitleClass Title: $'''*Google Chrome*''' Class: $'''*'''
 ON ERROR

 END
 END
 BLOCK 
ON BLOCK ERROR all

END
 IF IsNotEmpty(Input_URL) THEN
 WebAutomation.LaunchChrome.AttachToChromeByUrl TabUrl: Input_URL AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserToClose
 WebAutomation.CloseWebBrowser BrowserInstance: BrowserToClose
 Text.AppendLine Text: Output_Message LineToAppend: $'''Successfully closed browser %Input_Browser% tab with URL %Input_URL%''' Result=> Output_Message
 EXIT FUNCTION
 END
 IF (UIAutomation.IfWindow.IsOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''*Google Chrome*''' Class: $'''*''') THEN
 WebAutomation.LaunchChrome.AttachToForegroundChrome AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserToClose
 WebAutomation.CloseWebBrowser BrowserInstance: BrowserToClose
 END
 END
 IF (UIAutomation.IfWindow.IsOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''*Google Chrome*''' Class: $'''*''') THEN
 LOOP LoopIndex FROM 0 TO 10 STEP 1
 IF (System.IfProcess.ProcessIsRunning ProcessName: $'''chrome''') THEN
 ON ERROR

 END
 System.TerminateProcess.TerminateProcessByName ProcessName: $'''chrome'''
 ON ERROR

 END
 WAIT (System.WaitForProcess.ProcessToStop ProcessName: $'''chrome''') FOR 5 
 ON ERROR

 END
 ELSE
 EXIT LOOP
 END
 END
 END
 IF (UIAutomation.IfWindow.IsOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''*Google Chrome*''' Class: $'''*''') THEN
 SET Output_Status TO 500
 Text.AppendLine Text: Output_Message LineToAppend: $'''Failed to close Chrome.''' Result=> Output_Message
 END
END FUNCTION
FUNCTION CloseEdge GLOBAL
 IF (UIAutomation.IfWindow.IsNotOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''*Microsoft Edge*''' Class: $'''*''') THEN
 Text.AppendLine Text: Output_Message LineToAppend: $'''Browser %Input_Browser% is not open. Not closing it.''' Result=> Output_Message
 EXIT FUNCTION
 ELSE
 UIAutomation.CloseWindow.CloseByTitleClass Title: $'''*Microsoft Edge*''' Class: $'''*'''
 ON ERROR

 END
 END
 BLOCK 
ON BLOCK ERROR all

END
 IF IsNotEmpty(Input_URL) THEN
 WebAutomation.LaunchEdge.AttachToEdgeByUrl TabUrl: Input_URL AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserToClose
 WebAutomation.CloseWebBrowser BrowserInstance: BrowserToClose
 Text.AppendLine Text: Output_Message LineToAppend: $'''Successfully closed browser %Input_Browser% tab with URL %Input_URL%''' Result=> Output_Message
 EXIT FUNCTION
 END
 IF (UIAutomation.IfWindow.IsOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''*Microsoft Edge*''' Class: $'''*''') THEN
 WebAutomation.LaunchEdge.AttachToTheForegroundEdge AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserToClose
 WebAutomation.CloseWebBrowser BrowserInstance: BrowserToClose
 END
 END
 IF (UIAutomation.IfWindow.IsOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''*Microsoft Edge*''' Class: $'''*''') THEN
 LOOP LoopIndex FROM 0 TO 10 STEP 1
 IF (System.IfProcess.ProcessIsRunning ProcessName: $'''msedge''') THEN
 ON ERROR

 END
 System.TerminateProcess.TerminateProcessByName ProcessName: $'''msedge'''
 ON ERROR

 END
 WAIT (System.WaitForProcess.ProcessToStop ProcessName: $'''msedge''') FOR 5 
 ON ERROR

 END
 ELSE
 EXIT LOOP
 END
 END
 END
 IF (UIAutomation.IfWindow.IsOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''*Microsoft Edge*''' Class: $'''*''') THEN
 SET Output_Status TO 500
 Text.AppendLine Text: Output_Message LineToAppend: $'''Failed to close Edge.''' Result=> Output_Message
 END
END FUNCTION
FUNCTION CloseFirefox GLOBAL
 IF (UIAutomation.IfWindow.IsNotOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''*Mozilla Firefox*''' Class: $'''MozillaWindowClass''') THEN
 Text.AppendLine Text: Output_Message LineToAppend: $'''Browser %Input_Browser% is not open. Not closing it.''' Result=> Output_Message
 EXIT FUNCTION
 ELSE
 UIAutomation.CloseWindow.CloseByTitleClass Title: $'''*Mozilla Firefox*''' Class: $'''MozillaWindowClass'''
 ON ERROR

 END
 END
 BLOCK 
ON BLOCK ERROR all

END
 IF IsNotEmpty(Input_URL) THEN
 WebAutomation.LaunchFirefox.AttachToFirefoxByUrl TabUrl: Input_URL AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserToClose
 WebAutomation.CloseWebBrowser BrowserInstance: BrowserToClose
 Text.AppendLine Text: Output_Message LineToAppend: $'''Successfully closed browser %Input_Browser% tab with URL %Input_URL%''' Result=> Output_Message
 EXIT FUNCTION
 END
 IF (UIAutomation.IfWindow.IsOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''*Mozilla Firefox*''' Class: $'''MozillaWindowClass''') THEN
 WebAutomation.LaunchFirefox.AttachToForegroundFirefox AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserToClose
 WebAutomation.CloseWebBrowser BrowserInstance: BrowserToClose
 END
 END
 IF (UIAutomation.IfWindow.IsOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''*Mozilla Firefox*''' Class: $'''MozillaWindowClass''') THEN
 LOOP LoopIndex FROM 0 TO 10 STEP 1
 IF (System.IfProcess.ProcessIsRunning ProcessName: $'''firefox''') THEN
 ON ERROR

 END
 System.TerminateProcess.TerminateProcessByName ProcessName: $'''firefox'''
 ON ERROR

 END
 WAIT (System.WaitForProcess.ProcessToStop ProcessName: $'''firefox''') FOR 5 
 ON ERROR

 END
 ELSE
 EXIT LOOP
 END
 END
 END
 IF (UIAutomation.IfWindow.IsOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''*Mozilla Firefox*''' Class: $'''MozillaWindowClass''') THEN
 SET Output_Status TO 500
 Text.AppendLine Text: Output_Message LineToAppend: $'''Failed to close Firefox.''' Result=> Output_Message
 END
END FUNCTION
"

"@@ConnectionString: '' @@Type: 'Local' @@DesktopType: 'local' @@DisplayName: 'Local computer' IMPORT 'controlRepo.appmask' AS appmask IMPORT 'imageRepo.imgrepo' AS imgrepo @SENSITIVE: [Input_LogAddress, Input_ErrorMessageList, Output_ErrorMessage, Output_ErrorMessageList] @INPUT Input_SubflowNamesList : { 'Description': 'Provide the list of subflow names used in the flow invoking the Logger, so the Logger can fetch the last item from the list and use it as the name of the subflow that called it.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_SubflowNamesList', 'Type': 'List', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': [] } @INPUT Input_LoggerObject : { 'Description': 'Provide the Logger Object that contains \'LogLevels\' and \'ErrorLogLevels\' as parameters for defining which levels of messages to log and which to include to the error log list.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_LoggerObject', 'Type': 'CustomObject', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': {{ }} } @INPUT Input_LogPath : { 'Description': '''Provide the path for the log message to be written to. The path is a universal variable regardless of the type of the logs being made: When logging to file, the path should contain a file path. When logging to a database, it should contain the table name, etc.''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_LogPath', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } @INPUT Input_LogMessage : { 'Description': 'Provide the message to be logged.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_LogMessage', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } @INPUT Input_LogType : { 'Description': '''Provide the type of log to be created. Available options are: - Log File - CSV File - Database - SharePoint List''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_LogType', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } @INPUT Input_ErrorMessageList : { 'Description': 'Provide the list of existing error messages.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_ErrorMessageList', 'Type': 'List', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': [] } @OUTPUT Output_ErrorMessageList : { 'Description': 'Returns the error message list after adding the current message, if it was includided in the \"ErrorLogLevels\" property of the logger object.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_ErrorMessageList', 'Type': 'List' } @OUTPUT Output_ErrorMessage : { 'Description': 'Returns any errors that may have occurred during the flow run.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_ErrorMessage', 'Type': 'String' } @INPUT Input_FlowName : { 'Description': 'Provide the name of the flow that invokes the Logger.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_FlowName', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } @INPUT Input_ProjectName : { 'Description': 'Provide the name of the project that the flow invoking the Logger belongs to.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_ProjectName', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } @INPUT Input_LogAddress : { 'Description': '''Provide the address to log the log message to. This is optional when logging to files, but required when log type is: a) Database - This should then contain the connection string. b) SharePoint List - This should then contain the site address.''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_LogAddress', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': True } BLOCK ON BLOCK ERROR all END CALL Init SWITCH Input_LogType CASE = $'''Log File''' CALL LogToFile CASE = $'''CSV File''' CALL LogToCSV CASE = $'''Database''' CALL LogToDatabase CASE = $'''SharePoint List''' CALL LogToSharePoint DEFAULT SET Output_ErrorMessage TO $'''The log type \'%Input_LogType%\' is not supported by the Logger flow.''' END Variables.MergeLists FirstList: Input_ErrorMessageList SecondList: Output_ErrorMessageList OutputList=> Output_ErrorMessageList IF Contains(Input_LoggerObject['ErrorLogLevels'], Log_Level, True) THEN SET Log_Message TO $'''\"Level\": \"%Log_Level%\", \"Timestamp\": \"%Log_Timestamp%\", \"Subflow\": \"%Log_SubflowName%\", \"Message\": \"%Log_Message%\"''' Variables.AddItemToList Item: $'''%Log_Message%
''' List: Output_ErrorMessageList END EXIT Code: 0 END ERROR => Output_ErrorMessage FUNCTION LogToFile GLOBAL Text.ConvertDateTimeToText.FromCustomDateTime DateTime: CurrentDateTime CustomFormat: $'''yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fff''' Result=> Log_Timestamp IF Contains(Input_LoggerObject['LogLevels'], Log_Level, True) THEN File.WriteText File: Input_LogPath TextToWrite: $'''{\"Level\": \"%Log_Level%\", \"Timestamp\": \"%Log_Timestamp%\", \"Project\": \"%Input_ProjectName%\", \"Flow\": \"%Input_FlowName%\", \"Subflow\": \"%Log_SubflowName%\", \"Message\": \"%Log_Message%\"}''' AppendNewLine: True IfFileExists: File.IfFileExists.Append Encoding: File.FileEncoding.UTF8 END END FUNCTION FUNCTION Init GLOBAL DateTime.GetCurrentDateTime.Local DateTimeFormat: DateTime.DateTimeFormat.DateAndTime CurrentDateTime=> CurrentDateTime Text.SplitText.SplitWithDelimiter Text: Input_LogMessage CustomDelimiter: $''';;;''' IsRegEx: False Result=> Log_MessageList IF Log_MessageList.Count < 2 THEN SET Log_Level TO $'''WARN''' SET Log_Message TO $'''Found the list of expected message count to be less than 2. Cannot parse the message object correctly. Original message: %Log_Message%''' ELSE SET Log_Level TO Log_MessageList[0] SET Log_Message TO Log_MessageList[1] END Text.Replace Text: Log_Message TextToFind: $'''[\\r\\n]''' IsRegex: True IgnoreCase: False ReplaceWith: $'''%' '%''' ActivateEscapeSequences: False Result=> Log_Message Text.Replace Text: Log_Message TextToFind: $'''\\''' IsRegex: False IgnoreCase: False ReplaceWith: $'''/''' ActivateEscapeSequences: False Result=> Log_Message Text.Replace Text: Log_Message TextToFind: $'''\"''' IsRegex: False IgnoreCase: False ReplaceWith: $'''\'''' ActivateEscapeSequences: False Result=> Log_Message SET Log_SubflowName TO $'''Unknown''' IF Input_SubflowNamesList.Count <> 0 THEN SET Log_SubflowName TO Input_SubflowNamesList[Input_SubflowNamesList.Count - 1] END System.GetEnvironmentVariable.GetEnvironmentVariable Name: $'''COMPUTERNAME''' Value=> Log_MachineName END FUNCTION FUNCTION LogToCSV GLOBAL Text.ConvertDateTimeToText.FromCustomDateTime DateTime: CurrentDateTime CustomFormat: $'''yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fff''' Result=> Log_Timestamp IF (File.IfFile.DoesNotExist File: Input_LogPath) THEN # Creating a file with headers if it doesn't exist yet. File.WriteToCSVFile.WriteCSV VariableToWrite: {['Level', 'Timestamp', 'Project', 'Flow', 'Subflow', 'Message'] } CSVFile: Input_LogPath CsvFileEncoding: File.CSVEncoding.UTF8 IncludeColumnNames: False IfFileExists: File.IfFileExists.Overwrite ColumnsSeparator: File.CSVColumnsSeparator.Semicolon END IF Contains(Input_LoggerObject['LogLevels'], Log_Level, True) THEN File.WriteToCSVFile.WriteCSV VariableToWrite: {[Log_Level, Log_Timestamp, Input_ProjectName, Input_FlowName, Log_SubflowName, Log_Message] } CSVFile: Input_LogPath CsvFileEncoding: File.CSVEncoding.UTF8 IncludeColumnNames: False IfFileExists: File.IfFileExists.Append ColumnsSeparator: File.CSVColumnsSeparator.Semicolon END END FUNCTION FUNCTION LogToDatabase GLOBAL IF IsEmpty(Input_LogAddress) THEN SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Empty \'Input_LogAddress\' value provided. It is required when Log Type is \'%Input_LogType%\'.''' EXIT FUNCTION END @@copilotGeneratedAction: 'False' Database.ExecuteSqlStatement.ConnectAndExecute ConnectionString: Input_LogAddress Statement: $'''INSERT INTO %Input_LogPath% (Level, Machine, Project, Flow, Subflow, Message) VALUES (\'%Log_Level%\', \'%Log_MachineName%\', \'%Input_ProjectName%\', \'%Input_FlowName%\', \'%Log_SubflowName%\',\'%Log_Message%\')''' Timeout: 45 END FUNCTION FUNCTION LogToSharePoint GLOBAL IF IsEmpty(Input_LogAddress) THEN SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Empty \'Input_LogAddress\' value provided. It is required when Log Type is \'%Input_LogType%\'.''' EXIT FUNCTION END Text.ConvertDateTimeToText.FromCustomDateTime DateTime: CurrentDateTime CustomFormat: $'''yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss''' Result=> Log_Timestamp @@dataset: '%Input_LogAddress%' @@table: '%Input_LogAddress%' @@view: '' @@'InputSchema:item': '903008207' @@'OutputSchema:PostItemResponse': '-1550202392' @@connectionDisplayName: 'PADFramework_SharePoint' External.InvokeCloudConnector Connection: '2416a92f-89d3-403f-9e70-b61bce2dd7d8' ConnectorId: '/providers/Microsoft.PowerApps/apis/shared_sharepointonline' OperationId: 'PostItem' @dataset: Input_LogAddress @table: Input_LogPath @'item/Title': Log_Level @'item/Timestamp': Log_Timestamp @'item/Machine': Log_MachineName @'item/Project': Input_ProjectName @'item/Flow': Input_FlowName @'item/Subflow': Log_SubflowName @'item/Message': Log_Message @'item/FlowRunURL': $'''%''%''' @PostItemResponse=> PostItemResponse END FUNCTION FUNCTION LogToDatabaseSP GLOBAL IF IsEmpty(Input_LogAddress) THEN SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Empty \'Input_LogAddress\' value provided. It is required when Log Type is \'%Input_LogType%\'.''' EXIT FUNCTION END @@copilotGeneratedAction: 'False' Database.ExecuteSqlStatement.ConnectAndExecute ConnectionString: Input_LogAddress Statement: $'''EXEC %Input_LogPath% @Level = \'%Log_Level%\', @Machine = \'%Log_MachineName%\', @Project = \'%Input_ProjectName%\', @Flow = \'%Input_FlowName%\', @Subflow = \'%Log_SubflowName%\', @Message = \'%Log_Message%\';''' Timeout: 45 Result=> Table_SPResult IF Table_SPResult.IsEmpty = True THEN SET ErrorMessage TO $'''The database returned nothing when attempting to log the following message \'%Input_LogMessage%\'''' ELSE IF Table_SPResult[0]['Status'] < 0 THEN SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Status: %Table_SPResult[0]['Status']%, Message: %Table_SPResult[0]['Message']%''' END END FUNCTION "

Workflow.Name: PADFramework: BrowserLauncher
Workflow.Inputs:
{"schema":{"required":["Input_Browser","Input_URL","Input_IncognitoMode"],"properties":{"Input_Browser":{"isOptional":false,"default":"","description":"Please provide the browser to be launched.
Available options are: 
- Chrome
- Edge
- Firefox
- Internet Explorer","format":null,"title":"Input_Browser","type":"string","value":""},"Input_URL":{"isOptional":false,"default":"","description":"Please provide the URL to navigate to.","format":null,"title":"Input_URL","type":"string","value":""},"Input_IncognitoMode":{"isOptional":false,"default":"","description":"Please select whether or not the browser should be launched in Incognito/Private mode.","format":null,"title":"Input_IncognitoMode","type":"boolean","value":"False"}},"type":"object"}}
Workflow.Outputs: {"schema":{"properties":{"Output_Status":{"default":"","description":"The status of the flow. Uses standard HTTP status codes.","format":null,"title":"Output_Status","type":"number","value":null},"Output_Message":{"default":"","description":"The flow response.","format":"password","title":"Output_Message","type":"string","value":null}},"type":"object"}}
Workflow.Definition:
"@@ConnectionString: ''
@@Type: 'Local'
@@DesktopType: 'local'
@@DisplayName: 'Local computer'
IMPORT 'controlRepo.appmask' AS appmask
IMPORT 'imageRepo.imgrepo' AS imgrepo
@SENSITIVE: [Output_Message]
@INPUT Input_Browser : { 'Description': '''Please provide the browser to be launched.
Available options are: 
- Chrome
- Edge
- Firefox
- Internet Explorer''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_Browser', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@OUTPUT Output_Status : { 'Description': 'The status of the flow. Uses standard HTTP status codes.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_Status', 'Type': 'Numeric' } 
@OUTPUT Output_Message : { 'Description': 'The flow response.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_Message', 'Type': 'String' } 
@INPUT Input_URL : { 'Description': 'Please provide the URL to navigate to.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_URL', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@INPUT Input_IncognitoMode : { 'Description': 'Please select whether or not the browser should be launched in Incognito/Private mode.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_IncognitoMode', 'Type': 'Bool', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': False } 
# Setting the status and message to 'Bad Request' by default in case the flow fails.
SET Output_Status TO 400
SET Output_Message TO $'''Bad Request'''
BLOCK 
ON BLOCK ERROR all

END
 SET CommandLineArguments TO $'''www.google.com'''
 SWITCH Input_Browser
 CASE = $'''Chrome'''
 CALL LaunchChrome
 CASE = $'''Edge'''
 CALL LaunchEdge
 CASE = $'''Firefox'''
 CALL LaunchFirefox
 DEFAULT
 SET Output_Status TO 400
 SET Output_Message TO $'''Browser \'%Input_Browser%\' is not supported by the Browser Launcher flow.'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 WebAutomation.GoToWebPage.GoToWebPageCloseDialog BrowserInstance: BrowserInstance Url: Input_URL WaitForPageToLoadTimeout: 60
 SET Output_Status TO 200
 SET Output_Message TO $'''Successfully launched %Input_Browser% and navigated to %Input_URL%'''
 LABEL 'Exit'
 EXIT Code: 0
END
ERROR => ErrorMessage
SET Output_Status TO 500
SET Output_Message TO $'''Failed to launch %Input_Browser% browser due to %ErrorMessage%'''
FUNCTION LaunchChrome GLOBAL
 IF Input_IncognitoMode = True THEN
 SET CommandLineArguments TO $'''%CommandLineArguments% -incognito'''
 END
 System.RunApplication.RunApplication ApplicationPath: $'''chrome''' CommandLineArguments: CommandLineArguments WindowStyle: System.ProcessWindowStyle.Maximized ProcessId=> AppProcessId
 WAIT (UIAutomation.WaitForWindow.ToOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''Google*''' Class: $'''Chrome_WidgetWin_1''' FocusWindow: True) FOR 30
 WebAutomation.LaunchChrome.AttachToChromeByTitle TabTitle: $'''Google''' AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserInstance
END FUNCTION
FUNCTION LaunchEdge GLOBAL
 IF Input_IncognitoMode = True THEN
 SET CommandLineArguments TO $'''%CommandLineArguments% -inprivate'''
 END
 System.RunApplication.RunApplication ApplicationPath: $'''msedge''' CommandLineArguments: CommandLineArguments WindowStyle: System.ProcessWindowStyle.Maximized ProcessId=> AppProcessId
 WAIT (UIAutomation.WaitForWindow.ToOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''Google*''' Class: $'''Chrome_WidgetWin_1''' FocusWindow: True) FOR 30
 WebAutomation.LaunchEdge.AttachToEdgeByTitle TabTitle: $'''Google''' AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserInstance
END FUNCTION
FUNCTION LaunchFirefox GLOBAL
 IF Input_IncognitoMode = True THEN
 SET CommandLineArguments TO $'''%CommandLineArguments% -private'''
 END
 System.RunApplication.RunApplication ApplicationPath: $'''firefox''' CommandLineArguments: CommandLineArguments WindowStyle: System.ProcessWindowStyle.Maximized ProcessId=> AppProcessId
 WAIT (UIAutomation.WaitForWindow.ToOpenByTitleClass Title: $'''Google*''' Class: $'''MozillaWindowClass''' FocusWindow: True) FOR 30
 WebAutomation.LaunchFirefox.AttachToFirefoxByTitle TabTitle: $'''Google''' AttachTimeout: 5 BrowserInstance=> BrowserInstance
END FUNCTION
"

Uses standard HTTP status codes.","format":null,"title":"Output_Status","type":"number","value":null}},"type":"object"}}
Workflow.Definition:
"@@ConnectionString: ''
@@Type: 'Local'
@@DesktopType: 'local'
@@DisplayName: 'Local computer'
IMPORT 'controlRepo.appmask' AS appmask
IMPORT 'imageRepo.imgrepo' AS imgrepo
@SENSITIVE: [Input_EmailMessage, Input_EmailRecipient, Input_EmailRecipientCC, Output_Message]
@INPUT Input_Attachments : { 'Description': 'Provide attachments (if any) to be added to the email message in a form of a list of file paths.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_Attachments', 'Type': 'List', 'IsOptional': True, 'DefaultValue': [] } 
@INPUT Input_EmailMessage : { 'Description': '''Please provide the email message to be sent.
The message should be formatted as HTML. Otherwise, it will be sent as a single blob of text inside an HTML message.''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_EmailMessage', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@INPUT Input_EmailRecipient : { 'Description': '''Provide the recipient(s) to send the email to.
If multiple recipients are provided, separate them by a semicolon.''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_EmailRecipient', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@INPUT Input_EmailRecipientCC : { 'Description': '''Provide CC recipient(s) of the email (optional)
If multiple recipients are provided, separate them by a semicolon.''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_EmailRecipientCC', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': True } 
@INPUT Input_EmailSubject : { 'Description': 'Provide the subject text for the email.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_EmailSubject', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@INPUT Input_HTMLTemplatePath : { 'Description': 'Provide the path to the HTML template for the email body.', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_HTMLTemplatePath', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@OUTPUT Output_Message : { 'Description': 'The flow response.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_Message', 'Type': 'String' } 
@OUTPUT Output_Status : { 'Description': 'The status of the flow. Uses standard HTTP status codes.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_Status', 'Type': 'Numeric' } 
# Setting the status and message to 'Bad Request' by default in case the flow fails.
SET Output_Status TO 400
SET Output_Message TO $'''Bad Request'''
BLOCK 
ON BLOCK ERROR all

END
 CALL SetEmailBody
 IF IsNotEmpty(Input_Attachments) THEN
 CALL CreateAttachmentsObject
 @@'emailMessage/Sensitivity': ''
@@connectionDisplayName: 'PADFramework_Office365Outlook'
External.InvokeCloudConnector Connection: 'f8c42f8b-23a9-4a78-90c2-5fe372fdc8ed' ConnectorId: '/providers/Microsoft.PowerApps/apis/shared_office365' OperationId: 'SendEmailV2' @'emailMessage/To': Input_EmailRecipient @'emailMessage/Subject': Input_EmailSubject @'emailMessage/Body': HTMLEmailBody @'emailMessage/Cc': Input_EmailRecipientCC @'emailMessage/Attachments': List_AttachmentObjects
 ELSE
 @@'emailMessage/Sensitivity': ''
@@connectionDisplayName: 'PADFramework_Office365Outlook'
External.InvokeCloudConnector Connection: 'f8c42f8b-23a9-4a78-90c2-5fe372fdc8ed' ConnectorId: '/providers/Microsoft.PowerApps/apis/shared_office365' OperationId: 'SendEmailV2' @'emailMessage/To': Input_EmailRecipient @'emailMessage/Subject': Input_EmailSubject @'emailMessage/Body': HTMLEmailBody @'emailMessage/Cc': Input_EmailRecipientCC
 END
 SET Output_Status TO 200
 SET Output_Message TO $'''Successfully sent an email with subject text \'%Input_EmailSubject%\' to \'%Input_EmailRecipient%\''''
 LABEL 'Exit'
 EXIT Code: 0
END
ERROR => ErrorMessage
SET Output_Status TO 500
SET Output_Message TO $'''Failed to send an email due to %ErrorMessage%'''
FUNCTION SetEmailBody GLOBAL
 IF IsNotEmpty(Input_HTMLTemplatePath) THEN
 File.ReadTextFromFile.ReadText File: Input_HTMLTemplatePath Encoding: File.TextFileEncoding.UTF8 Content=> HTMLEmailBody
 Text.Replace Text: HTMLEmailBody TextToFind: $'''{EmailMessage}''' IsRegEx: False IgnoreCase: False ReplaceWith: Input_EmailMessage ActivateEscapeSequences: False Result=> HTMLEmailBody
 ELSE
 SET HTMLEmailBody TO Input_EmailMessage
 END
END FUNCTION
FUNCTION CreateAttachmentsObject GLOBAL
 Variables.CreateNewList List=> List_AttachmentObjects
 LOOP FOREACH CurrentAttachment IN Input_Attachments
 File.ConvertToBinary File: CurrentAttachment BinaryData=> BinaryData
 File.GetPathPart File: CurrentAttachment FileName=> FileName
 Variables.AddItemToList Item: { 'Name': FileName, 'ContentBytes': BinaryData } List: List_AttachmentObjects
 END
END FUNCTION
"

Uses standard HTTP status codes.","format":null,"title":"Output_Status","type":"number","value":null}},"type":"object"}}
Workflow.Definition:
"@@ConnectionString: ''
@@Type: 'Local'
@@DesktopType: 'local'
@@DisplayName: 'Local computer'
IMPORT 'controlRepo.appmask' AS appmask
IMPORT 'imageRepo.imgrepo' AS imgrepo
@SENSITIVE: [Output_ConfigObject, Output_Message, Input_ConfigPath, Input_ConfigAddress]
@OUTPUT Output_ConfigObject : { 'Description': 'The config values as a custom object.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_ConfigObject', 'Type': 'CustomObject' } 
@OUTPUT Output_Message : { 'Description': 'The flow response.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_Message', 'Type': 'String' } 
@OUTPUT Output_Status : { 'Description': 'The status of the flow. Uses standard HTTP status codes.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_Status', 'Type': 'Numeric' } 
@INPUT Input_ConfigType : { 'Description': '''The type of Config source to be parsed.
Currently supported options are:
- JSON
- Excel
- Database
- Dataverse
- SharePoint''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_ConfigType', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@INPUT Input_ConfigPath : { 'Description': '''The path to the config data. Expects different values based on Config type:
- \'JSON\' - file path
- \'Excel\' - sheet name
- \'SharePoint\' - list name
- \'Dataverse\' - table logical name
- \'Database\' - stored procedure name''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_ConfigPath', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@INPUT Input_ConfigAddress : { 'Description': '''The address of the Config.
Optional when Config type is \'JSON\'.
Expects a connection string when Config type is \'Database\', 
Expects a site address when Config type is \'SharePoint\'.
Expects an environment URL when Config type is \'Dataverse\'.
Expects a file path when ConfigType is \'Excel\'.''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_ConfigAddress', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': True } 
@INPUT Input_ProjectName : { 'Description': '''The project name/number/Id that can be used to identify the config in the database.
Optional when Config type is \'JSON\' or \'Excel\'.''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_ProjectName', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': True } 
# Setting the status and message to 'Bad Request' by default in case the flow fails.
SET Output_Status TO 400
SET Output_Message TO $'''Bad Request'''
BLOCK 
ON BLOCK ERROR all

END
 SWITCH Input_ConfigType
 CASE = $'''JSON'''
 CALL ReadJSONConfig
 CASE = $'''Excel'''
 CALL ReadExcelConfig
 CASE = $'''Database'''
 CALL ReadDatabaseConfig
 CASE = $'''Dataverse'''
 CALL ReadDataverseConfig
 CASE = $'''SharePoint'''
 CALL ReadSharePointConfig
 DEFAULT
 SET Output_Status TO 400
 SET Output_Message TO $'''Browser \'%Input_ConfigType%\' is not supported by the Config Reader flow.'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN
 # Business exceptions are considered to be BadRequest.
 SET Output_Status TO 400
 SET Output_Message TO $'''Failed to read config values due to %ErrorMessage%'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 SET Output_Status TO 200
 SET Output_Message TO $'''Successfully retrieved config values.'''
 LABEL 'Exit'
 EXIT Code: 0
END
ERROR => ErrorMessage
SET Output_Status TO 500
SET Output_Message TO $'''Failed to read config values due to %ErrorMessage%'''
FUNCTION ReadJSONConfig GLOBAL
 File.ReadTextFromFile.ReadText File: Input_Configpath Encoding: File.TextFileEncoding.UTF8 Content=> ConfigData
 Variables.ConvertJsonToCustomObject Json: ConfigData CustomObject=> Output_ConfigObject
END FUNCTION
FUNCTION ReadExcelConfig GLOBAL
 IF IsEmpty(Input_ConfigAddress) THEN
 SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Empty Input_ConfigAddress parameter provided. It is required for config type %Input_ConfigType%.'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 Excel.LaunchExcel.LaunchAndOpenUnderExistingProcess Path: Input_ConfigAddress Visible: False ReadOnly: True Instance=> ExcelInstance
 Excel.SetActiveWorksheet.ActivateWorksheetByName Instance: ExcelInstance Name: Input_ConfigPath
 Excel.ReadFromExcel.ReadAllCells Instance: ExcelInstance ReadAsText: False FirstLineIsHeader: True RangeValue=> Table_ConfigData
 Excel.CloseExcel.Close Instance: ExcelInstance
 ON ERROR
 CALL RunExcelCloser
 END
 IF IsNotEmpty(ErrorMessage) THEN
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 CALL ConvertTabularConfigToCustomObject
 LABEL 'Exit'
END FUNCTION
FUNCTION RunExcelCloser GLOBAL
 @@flowname: 'PADFramework: ExcelCloser'
External.RunFlow FlowId: 'a261fa2e-fce6-49c8-909a-a94012906030' @Input_FilePath: Input_ConfigAddress @Output_Message=> Output_Message @Output_Status=> Output_Status
 IF Output_Status <> 200 THEN
 SET ErrorMessage TO Output_Message
 END
END FUNCTION
FUNCTION ReadDatabaseConfig GLOBAL
 IF IsEmpty(Input_ConfigAddress) THEN
 SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Empty Input_ConfigAddress parameter provided. It is required for config type %Input_ConfigType%.'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 ELSE IF IsEmpty(Input_ProjectName) THEN
 SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Empty Input_ProjectName parameter provided. It is required for config type %Input_ConfigType%.'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 @@copilotGeneratedAction: 'False'
Database.ExecuteSqlStatement.ConnectAndExecute ConnectionString: Input_ConfigAddress Statement: $'''EXEC %Input_ConfigPath% @ProjectNumber = \'%Input_ProjectName%\';''' Timeout: 180 Result=> Table_ConfigData
 IF Table_ConfigData.IsEmpty = $'''true''' THEN
 SET ErrorMessage TO $'''The database returned nothing when trying to get config values.'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 ELSE IF Table_ConfigData[0]['Status'] < 0 THEN
 SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Status: %Table_ConfigData[0]['Status']%, Message: %Table_ConfigData[0]['Message']%'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 CALL ConvertTabularConfigToCustomObject
 LABEL 'Exit'
END FUNCTION
FUNCTION ReadDataverseConfig GLOBAL
 IF IsEmpty(Input_ConfigAddress) THEN
 SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Empty Input_ConfigAddress parameter provided. It is required for config type %Input_ConfigType%.'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 ELSE IF IsEmpty(Input_ProjectName) THEN
 SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Empty Input_ProjectName parameter provided. It is required for config type %Input_ConfigType%.'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 # Getting the prefix from the table name, as it is also used in logical column names.
 Text.ParseText.RegexParseForFirstOccurrence Text: Input_ConfigPath TextToFind: $'''^[^_]+_''' StartingPosition: 0 IgnoreCase: False Match=> Prefix
 SET ColumnName_ProjectNumber TO $'''%Prefix%projectnumber'''
 SET ColumnName_FlowName TO $'''%Prefix%flowname'''
 SET ColumnName_PropertyName TO $'''%Prefix%propertyname'''
 SET ColumnName_Value TO $'''%Prefix%value'''
 @@organization: '%Input_ConfigAddress%'
@@entityName: '%Input_ConfigPath%'
@@connectionDisplayName: 'PADFramework_Dataverse'
External.InvokeCloudConnector Connection: '01b026b7-a356-41c6-b0e7-e0d51d248923' ConnectorId: '/providers/Microsoft.PowerApps/apis/shared_commondataserviceforapps' OperationId: 'ListRecordsWithOrganization' @organization: Input_ConfigAddress @entityName: Input_ConfigPath @'$filter': $'''%ColumnName_ProjectNumber% eq \'%Input_ProjectName%\'''' @ListRecordsWithOrganizationResponse=> ListRecordsWithOrganizationResponse
 Variables.CreateNewDatatable InputTable: { ^['Flow Name', 'Property Name', 'Value'], [$'''''', $'''''', $''''''] } DataTable=> Table_ConfigData
 LOOP FOREACH CurrentItem IN ListRecordsWithOrganizationResponse['value']
 Variables.AddRowToDataTable.AppendRowToDataTable DataTable: Table_ConfigData RowToAdd: [CurrentItem[ColumnName_FlowName], CurrentItem[ColumnName_PropertyName], CurrentItem[ColumnName_Value]]
 END
 CALL ConvertTabularConfigToCustomObject
 LABEL 'Exit'
END FUNCTION
FUNCTION ReadSharePointConfig GLOBAL
 IF IsEmpty(Input_ConfigAddress) THEN
 SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Empty Input_ConfigAddress parameter provided. It is required for config type %Input_ConfigType%.'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 ELSE IF IsEmpty(Input_ProjectName) THEN
 SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Empty Input_ProjectName parameter provided. It is required for config type %Input_ConfigType%.'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 @@dataset: '%Input_ConfigAddress%'
@@table: '%Input_ConfigPath%'
@@folderPath: ''
@@viewScopeOption: ''
@@view: ''
@@connectionDisplayName: 'PADFramework_SharePoint'
External.InvokeCloudConnector Connection: '9c94fd45-2b5a-417f-8cbf-1ef6a134e654' ConnectorId: '/providers/Microsoft.PowerApps/apis/shared_sharepointonline' OperationId: 'GetItems' @dataset: Input_ConfigAddress @table: Input_ConfigPath @'$filter': $'''ProjectNumber eq \'%Input_ProjectName%\'''' @GetItemsResponse=> GetItemsResponse
 Variables.CreateNewDatatable InputTable: { ^['Flow Name', 'Property Name', 'Value'], [$'''''', $'''''', $''''''] } DataTable=> Table_ConfigData
 LOOP FOREACH CurrentItem IN GetItemsResponse['value']
 Variables.AddRowToDataTable.AppendRowToDataTable DataTable: Table_ConfigData RowToAdd: [CurrentItem['Flow Name'], CurrentItem['Property Name'], CurrentItem['Value']]
 END
 CALL ConvertTabularConfigToCustomObject
 LABEL 'Exit'
END FUNCTION
FUNCTION ConvertTabularConfigToCustomObject GLOBAL
 Variables.DeleteEmptyRowsFromDataTable DataTable: Table_ConfigData
 Variables.DeleteDuplicateRowsFromDataTable DataTable: Table_ConfigData
 SET Output_ConfigObject TO {{ }}
 SET Output_ConfigObject['Flows'] TO {{ }}
 LOOP FOREACH CurrentItem IN Table_ConfigData
 IF IsEmpty(CurrentItem['Property Name']) THEN
 EXIT LOOP
 END
 IF (IsEmpty(CurrentItem['Flow Name']) OR CurrentItem['Flow Name'] = 'General') = True THEN
 SET Output_ConfigObject[CurrentItem['Property Name']] TO CurrentItem['Value']
 ELSE IF Contains(Output_ConfigObject['Flows'], CurrentItem['Flow Name'], False) THEN
 SET Output_ConfigObject['Flows'][CurrentItem['Flow Name']][CurrentItem['Property Name']] TO CurrentItem['Value']
 ELSE
 SET FlowObject TO {{ }}
 SET FlowObject[CurrentItem['Property Name']] TO CurrentItem['Value']
 SET Output_ConfigObject['Flows'][CurrentItem['Flow Name']] TO FlowObject
 END
 END
END FUNCTION
"

Workflow.Inputs: {"schema":{"properties":{"Input_ScreenshotsDirectory":{"default":"","description":"Please provide the directory to store the screenshot to.\r\nIf the directory is left empty, or does not exist, the screenshot will not be taken.","format":null,"title":"Input_ScreenshotsDirectory","type":"string","value":null,"isOptional":true},"Input_ScreenshotFileName":{"default":"","description":"Please provide a file name for the screenshot. Do not include an extension.\r\nBy default, ScreenshotTaker will add a timestamp to the end of the file name.","format":null,"title":"Input_ScreenshotFileName","type":"string","value":"","isOptional":false}},"required":["Input_ScreenshotFileName"],"type":"object"}}
Workflow.Outputs: {"schema":{"properties":{"Output_Message":{"default":"","description":"The flow response.","format":"password","title":"Output_Message","type":"string","value":null,"isOptional":true},"Output_Status":{"default":"","description":"The status of the flow. Uses standard HTTP status codes.","format":null,"title":"Output_Status","type":"number","value":null,"isOptional":true}},"required":[],"type":"object"}}
Workflow.Definition:
"@@ConnectionString: ''
@@Type: 'Local'
@@DesktopType: 'local'
@@DisplayName: 'Local computer'
IMPORT 'controlRepo.appmask' AS appmask
IMPORT 'imageRepo.imgrepo' AS imgrepo
@SENSITIVE: [Output_Message]
@INPUT Input_ScreenshotsDirectory : { 'Description': '''Please provide the directory to store the screenshot to.
If the directory is left empty, or does not exist, the screenshot will not be taken.''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_ScreenshotsDirectory', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': True } 
@INPUT Input_ScreenshotFileName : { 'Description': '''Please provide a file name for the screenshot. Do not include an extension.
By default, ScreenshotTaker will add a timestamp to the end of the file name.''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_ScreenshotFileName', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' } 
@OUTPUT Output_Message : { 'Description': 'The flow response.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_Message', 'Type': 'String' } 
@OUTPUT Output_Status : { 'Description': 'The status of the flow. Uses standard HTTP status codes.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_Status', 'Type': 'Numeric' } 
# Setting the status and message to 'Bad Request' by default in case the flow fails.
SET Output_Status TO 400
SET Output_Message TO $'''Bad Request'''
BLOCK 
ON BLOCK ERROR all

END
 IF IsEmpty(Input_ScreenshotsDirectory) THEN
 SET Output_Status TO 422
 SET Output_Message TO $'''Empty screenshots directory parameter provided. Screenshot will not be taken.'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 IF (Folder.IfFolderExists.DoesNotExist Path: Input_ScreenshotsDirectory) THEN
 SET Output_Status TO 404
 SET Output_Message TO $'''The provided screenshots directory at \'%Input_ScreenshotsDirectory%\' does not exist. Screenshot will not be taken.'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 DateTime.GetCurrentDateTime.Local DateTimeFormat: DateTime.DateTimeFormat.DateAndTime CurrentDateTime=> CurrentDateTime
 Text.ConvertDateTimeToText.FromCustomDateTime DateTime: CurrentDateTime CustomFormat: $'''yyyy-MM-dd HHmmss''' Result=> Timestamp
 SET ScreenshotFilePath TO $'''%Input_ScreenshotsDirectory%\\%Input_ScreenshotFileName% %Timestamp%.png'''
 Workstation.TakeScreenshot.TakeScreenshotOfPrimaryScreenAndSaveToFile File: ScreenshotFilePath ImageFormat: System.ImageFormat.Png
 SET Output_Status TO 200
 SET Output_Message TO $'''Successfully took screenshot and saved it as \'%ScreenshotFilePath%\''''
 LABEL 'Exit'
 EXIT Code: 0
END
ERROR => ErrorMessage
SET Output_Status TO 500
SET Output_Message TO $'''Failed to take screenshot due to %ErrorMessage%'''
"

Workflow.Inputs: {"schema":{"required":[],"properties":{"Input_FilePath":{"isOptional":true,"default":"","description":"Please provide the path to the document that should be closed.\r\nIf no path is provided, all active Excel instances will be closed.","format":null,"title":"Input_FilePath","type":"string","value":null}},"type":"object"}}

Uses standard HTTP status codes.","format":null,"title":"Output_Status","type":"number","value":null}},"type":"object"}}
Workflow.Definition:
"@@ConnectionString: ''
@@Type: 'Local'
@@DesktopType: 'local'
@@DisplayName: 'Local computer'
IMPORT 'controlRepo.appmask' AS appmask
IMPORT 'imageRepo.imgrepo' AS imgrepo
@SENSITIVE: [Output_Message]
@INPUT Input_FilePath : { 'Description': '''Please provide the path to the document that should be closed.
If no path is provided, all active Excel instances will be closed.''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_FilePath', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': True } 
@OUTPUT Output_Message : { 'Description': 'The flow response.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_Message', 'Type': 'String' } 
@OUTPUT Output_Status : { 'Description': 'The status of the flow. Uses standard HTTP status codes.', 'FriendlyName': 'Output_Status', 'Type': 'Numeric' } 
SET Output_Status TO 200
BLOCK 
ON BLOCK ERROR all

END
 IF (System.IfProcess.ProcessIsNotRunning ProcessName: $'''EXCEL''') THEN
 ON ERROR

 END
 SET Output_Message TO $'''Excel is not running. Will not attempt to close it.'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 IF IsNotEmpty(Input_FilePath) THEN
 Excel.Attach DocumentName: Input_FilePath Instance=> ExcelToClose
 Excel.CloseExcel.Close Instance: ExcelToClose
 WAIT (System.WaitForProcess.ProcessToStop ProcessName: $'''EXCEL''') FOR 10 
 ON ERROR TimeoutError

 END
 IF (System.IfProcess.ProcessIsNotRunning ProcessName: $'''EXCEL''') THEN
 ON ERROR

 END
 SET Output_Message TO $'''Successfully closed Excel instance for document %Input_FilePath%'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 END
 LOOP FROM 1 TO 10 STEP 1
 IF (System.IfProcess.ProcessIsRunning ProcessName: $'''EXCEL''') THEN
 ON ERROR

 END
 @@copilotGeneratedAction: 'False'
Scripting.RunPowershellScript.RunPowershellScript Script: $'''$excel = [Runtime.Interopservices.Marshal]::GetActiveObject(\'Excel.Application\')
$excel.Visible = $false
$excel.DisplayAlerts = $false

$excel.Quit()
[System.Runtime.Interopservices.Marshal]::ReleaseComObject($excel)
Remove-Variable -Name Excel 
[GC]::Collect() 
[GC]::WaitForPendingFinalizers()
if ($excel.Workbooks.Count -eq 0)
{
 Stop-Process -Name EXCEL -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
}''' ScriptOutput=> PowershellOutput
 WAIT (System.WaitForProcess.ProcessToStop ProcessName: $'''EXCEL''') FOR 5 
 ON ERROR

 END
 ELSE
 EXIT LOOP
 END
 END
 LOOP FROM 1 TO 10 STEP 1
 IF (System.IfProcess.ProcessIsRunning ProcessName: $'''EXCEL''') THEN
 ON ERROR

 END
 System.TerminateProcess.TerminateProcessByName ProcessName: $'''EXCEL'''
 ON ERROR

 END
 WAIT (System.WaitForProcess.ProcessToStop ProcessName: $'''EXCEL''') FOR 5 
 ON ERROR

 END
 ELSE
 EXIT LOOP
 END
 END
 IF (System.IfProcess.ProcessIsRunning ProcessName: $'''EXCEL''') THEN
 ON ERROR

 END
 SET Output_Status TO 500
 SET ErrorMessage TO $'''Failed to properly close excel'''
 GOTO 'Exit'
 END
 SET Output_Message TO $'''Successfully closed Excel'''
 LABEL 'Exit'
 EXIT Code: 0
END
ERROR => ErrorMessage
SET Output_Status TO 500
SET Output_Message TO $'''Failed to close Excel due to %ErrorMessage%'''
"

"@@ConnectionString: ''
@@Type: 'Local'

IMPORT 'controlRepo.appmask' AS appmask

@SENSITIVE: [Input_WorkItemData, Input_WorkItemMessage, Output_WorkItemData, Input_WorkItemDataSource, Output_WorkItemDataSource, Output_Message, Input_ConnectionString]
@INPUT Input_WorkItemOperation : { 'Description': '''Provide the name of the operation to perform on the work item.
Available options:
- Complete
- Get
- Upsert''', 'FriendlyName': 'Input_WorkItemOperation', 'Type': 'String', 'IsOptional': False, 'DefaultValue': '' }
